113001.name: Namco Museum Remix
113001.description:
Namco Museum Remix is a part of the Namco Museum series of arcade compilations. In common with them, it includes a collection of classic arcade titles; however, these are ports, rather than being emulated, and are presented in the same style as in Namco Museum Battle Collection for the PlayStation Portable. Remix also adds five titular "Remix" versions, with updated graphics and gameplay, which differs from the originals, in some cases significantly (for example, in Galaga Remix, players not only have to protect themselves, but also protect Pac-Man as he rolls through space). The "Remix" games feature Miis, and each minigame is presented as an "attraction" in an amusement park—in fact, when released in Japan, the compilation was retitled "Minna de Asobou! Namco Carnival" (みんなで遊ぼう!ナムコカーニバル lit. "Everybody Plays! Namco Carnival").
This collection marks the first appearances of the arcade versions of Super Pac-Man and Gaplus since Namco Museum Vol. 2 for the PlayStation, as well as the first ever U.S. Namco Museum appearances of Cutie Q (which appeared in the Japanese version of Namco Museum Vol. 2) and Pac & Pal (which was released in arcades in Japan only).

Source: Wikipedia, "Namco Museum Remix", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113002.name: Nostalgia
113002.description:
Nostalgia is a traditional console role-playing game featuring three-dimensional characters and environments. Players control a young London boy named Eddie and his compatriots as they travel across an alternate history 19th-century Earth on a high-powered zeppelin, visiting various locales and raiding ruins in order to uncover the truth about an ancient civilization, as well as find Eddie's lost father. In order to advance the story, players must visit towns and interact with non-player characters to obtains clues on their next destination, as well as traverse dangerous dungeons and environments in order to find hidden treasures. Taking advantage of the Nintendo DS's dual screens, gameplay is featured on one screen while a map of the player's current location is present on the other, which fills as they travel through new areas. While traveling through the game, the player will randomly encounter enemies as they move through dangerous areas, which must be defeated in battle.
Battles in Nostalgia use a turn-based combat system where both characters and enemies acting in an order relative to their "speed" statistic. A Combat Order bar is present in battles that shows which of the player's party members or enemies will act next, with the player selecting a character's command just before their turn. In any given turn, a player may choose to attack an enemy, defend, use an item for beneficial effects, or use special skills unique to each character. In addition to ground battles, a player may also encounter enemies while in their airship, leading to a ship-to-ship combat sequence with unique commands. Players must defeat all of their enemies by attacking them until their hit points are extinguished, which grants each character experience points that go towards gaining levels, thus making them stronger and giving them access to more abilities. The player's party is judged at the end of each battle with a letter grade based on their actions in combat, and is determined by how quickly and flawlessly they have defeated their enemies and may give additional rewards.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nostalgia (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113003.name: Shrek 2 (GBA)

videogameversion.136517: North American Game Boy Advance edition

videogamehonor.32637: 2006 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee

113003.description:
Box Description:

The adventure continues!

...With all new characters and far-out locations never seen before!

-Switch between Shrek and 4 of his pals - each with their own powers.

113004.name: Starfarer Player's Guide
113004.description:
Starfarer Basics
Starfarer has these features (at least, what is done of the game does):

Characters are generated by buying skills, attributes, advantages, and drawbacks with character creation points (a major divergence from my favorite published SFRPG, MegaTraveller.)
While character creation is skill based, the buy scheme and templates help prevent the abuses inherent in many skill-based games.
The task resolution system is percentile based, and has a success level system in place.
The combat system is designed to lean towards the realistic, tempered by a slight bit of the cinematic. Damage is handled primarily by recording individual wounds, but there is an overall system shock and bleeding system in place.

113005.name: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl

videogameversion.136521: North American Game Boy Advance edition

113005.description:
Just like the film, Jack Sparrow fails to listen to Barbossa and walks the plank. He then ends up in a jungle, later finding himself in Port Royal, fighting people such as British Soldiers and pirates along the way.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113006.name: Starcraft D6
113006.description:
Introduction
Generations ago, starships carrying a large group of human exiles crash landed light-years away from Earth without any means of communicating with the homeworld. Over the decades, this rag-tag group of Terrans built thriving societies upon a handful of planets in the Koprulu Sector. Believing themselves masters of that region, the Terrans were little prepared for the arrival of more advanced alien species.

First, unbeknownst to the Terrans, a voracious race of genetically engineered beings, known as the Zerg, managed to infect a few Terran colonies with their spores. Then, a highly advanced, psionic race called the Protoss appeared and eradicated all forms of life upon the infected colonies in hopes of wiping out the Zerg. Suddenly, wedged between the savage Zerg and the brutal Protoss, the Terrans have found themselves struggling to survive in the reaches of deep space.

Here, in the Koprulu Sector, these three species vie for dominance, their very existence hanging in the balance.

113007.name: Bird Week
113007.description:
General gameplay:

The player plays as a bird and can either play the normal game or the study game. Both game modes are nearly identical except the study game only allows the player to play through one level[4] of their choice before abruptly ending. The player must feed butterflies to the baby birds so that they can grow big and eventually leave the nest.[5] It is suggested that they eventually become the "new mother birds" that take care of their offspring in the subsequent levels. There is an ending to this game. However, reaching the end requires considerable patience because it only comes out at the end of level 999 (approximately 28 repetitions of the game's thirty-six levels).

Each level represents a season in the ecosystem of a bird. The game starts out in early spring. As the virtual year progresses, the season evolves into summer and eventually into autumn. After autumn, the game repeats itself by portraying the following spring. Since harmful influences from sentient beings are not simulated in the game play, the forest that the birds live in is presumed to be a nature preserve. If the proper amount of butterflies are not fed to the babies, then the babies end up starving to death. The player will automatically lose a life if any of the baby bird dies. In addition to this, the player also loses a life when a predator catches the player trying to deliver butterflies to whose baby.[4]

Although the game is titled "Bird Week," the flow of seasons make it seem like virtual years are passing by (as opposed to virtual days of a week). There is no winter in the game because many of the game's enemies are that of the insect, bird, and small mammal species.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bird Week", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113008.name: Make Trax
113008.description:
Gameplay:

Make Trax is a maze game similar to Sega's Head On and Namco's Pac-Man, in which the player controls a paintbrush and must paint the entire layout in order to advance to the next stage. Two fish — one yellow, the other light blue — emerge from separate aquariums to pursue the paintbrush around the board, and if either of the fish succeeds in making contact with the paintbrush, the player loses one of three lives.

The player may use two "rollers" to attack the fish. The rollers are located on two overpasses, one vertical in its orientation, the other horizontal. To utilize a roller, the player positions the paintbrush on the forward end of the roller, waits for either or both of the fish to approach, then pushes the paintbrush along the roller, attacking the fish. The fish is removed from the maze for a few seconds, then returns to one of the aquariums and resumes its pursuit of the paintbrush. Killing fish in this manner scores bonus points.

A third character, appearing to be an animal or human figure depending on the level, may enter the maze and leave tracks that must be painted over in order for the board to be completed. The player can limit the damage by running over the figure, which not only stops further tracks from being left but also awards the player a score, which progressively increases as more boards are cleared.

Source: Wikipedia, "Make Trax", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113009.name: StarCadets: Basic Rules
113009.description:
User Summary:

StarCadets is a simple ruleset where characters may roll 2 d6s for both of their attributes (strength and brains). The rest of the game is built on simple die rolls and modifiers and the game narrative.

113010.name: Bomb Sweeper
113010.description:
User Summary

You, John Solver need to defuse bombs set by the boss, Jack. You must move through a maze in order to reach the bomb. You have the ability to move walls unless there's another wall blocking the path of the wall you're trying to move. As you progress through the levels, the screen will start moving and you must reach an exit after diffusing a bomb.

113011.description:
This expansion is included in the second edition of the base game.

The war for the crown has not yet ceased ... not even when the sun goes down. While the war rages on during the day, both princes and their armies hope to catch the other unawares under the blanket of darkness, when all is thought to be quiet on the field. However, both sides have come well prepared, going through lengths to recruit special units to surprise their enemy, including a Phantom to cloak itself in the darkness and capture the King and Heirs.

From our popular deck-building game, For the Crown, comes the first expansion, Cover of Night, introducing a new range of units, and an additional Sovereign, to pit against your opponent. Can you strategize your units wisely on the dark battlefield? Find out if you have what it takes to effectively conquer the kingdom under the Cover of Night!

Note, the For the Crown Expansion Kit 1: Cover of Night is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of For the Crown to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit represents a brave fighter on the chessboard of battle.

Game Components:

• 42 double-sided 3/4" unit counters
• 40 deck-building cards
• One page full color Rules sheet (Player Aid included)

boardgameversion.136532: For the Crown Expansion Kit 1: Cover of Night

113011.name: For the Crown Expansion Kit 1: Cover of Night

113012.name: Keep Away!
113012.description: A memory-matching card game used to teach children about fire, fire hazards and fire safety. The 30 cards are laid out face down and players turn cards over to make matches. When a correct pair is found, it is removed from the board and the player scores a point. If a match card or lighter card is turned over, it is removed from the game along with the other overturned card. The player with the most points wins.

113013.name: Fading Suns Shards Collection: Volume One
113013.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A ROAD SO DARK
In this adventure, the characters research a previously unknown night road between Leagueheim and Grail, following a trail of evidence to an artifact invaluable to their employer...

KRAKEN'S LOOM
In this adventure, the characters search for a Hawkwood Count, a prominent diplomat whose ship was lost in the outer reaches of the Leminkainen system. The trail leads to Hargard, however, where they learn that there are many fates worse than death...

RUINOUS FOLLY
In this adventure, the characters explore the secrets of an ancient think machine, following a treasure map into the turbulent atmosphere of the gas giant Gargantua. However, they are not the only ones, and the treasure they find has plans of its own...

DEAD END
In this adventure the characters travel to Kish to attend a religious ceremony, but are soon drawn into an obscure plot of murder and intrigue. As the characters follow the track of an unknown assailant who tried to assassinate Baron Sun Cho Li Halan’s young wife, they are about to discover a disturbing secret far greater than just the identity of a mere criminal...

Shards Collection Volume One is a collection of four stand-alone dramas for Fading Suns Second Edition, designed for a group of three to five player characters from all factions.

113015.name: Geimos
113015.description:
There are two modes; one has the camera angle in a fixed position while the other mode moves the camera around to keep the player's ship in the center of the screen.

The same 260 rounds that will repeat themselves until the player loses his final ship. After accomplishing 999990 points, The score resets to zero, making it impossible to have a kill screen or specific sequence to end the game in a positive manner. Round 0 is the easiest round while Round P5 (also known as Round 260) is the most difficult round - there are so many levels that even labeling them defies traditional hexadecimal numbering schemes. An anti-aircraft gun tower serves to remind players that the boss is near.

The boss happens to be a starship that is bigger than the other ships on the leader; thus continuing the tradition of video game bosses.While the first stages start out farther away in the Solar System, the final battle takes place on Phobos where the player has to take on the final boss.

Source: Wikipedia, "Geimos", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113016.name: Star Blades Rules
113016.description:
User Summary
The rules for Star Blades, including the introduction, descriptions of dice, miniatures, characters, classes, armour, movement and other rules.

113017.name: Space Invaders Get Even
113017.description:
The origins of the game lie with the original classic arcade game Space Invaders. However, Space Invaders Get Even puts a twist on the formula by letting the player control the space invaders themselves.
Breaking away from the gameplay of the original game and its spin-offs, Space Invaders Get Even sees players piloting the invader's UFO across a landscape rendered in 3D graphics, which encompasses areas such as cities, deserts, forests, oceans and military bases. By downloading the extra stages, players are also given the option to swap out the UFO in the game with ships from the Darius and RayForce series of Taito shoot 'em ups, as well as a polygonal version of the "classic" UFO from Space Invaders.
Players move the UFO with the analog stick of the Nunchuk, and then use the pointer function of the Wii Remote to direct a swarm of up to 100 invaders in blowing up buildings and destroying the defending forces of Earth, with continuing destruction increasing the time available to the player. The invaders, which are rendered as flat, glowing two dimensional sprites which resemble the invaders in the original game, can utilize a number of attack formations to dispatch enemies, including forming a drill-like formation to bore into them or crushing them by bouncing on top of them from above. Over time, human forces will shoot down the player's invader troops, which the player replenishes by shaking the Wiimote. Upon eliminating all opposition in the stage, which includes fighter jets, helicopter gunships and gunboats, the player must then take on a large boss, which include a giant tank, mecha and a huge battleship.
The game also features online leaderboards.

Source: Wikipedia, "Space Invaders Get Even", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113018.name: Star Blades: The Arminian Empire
113018.description:
Introduction
Unlike Walt’s Telkan Empire, this universe is based around a map of our own galaxy, divided into 21 rather arbitrarily bounded "sectors". It is immense compared to Walt’s Telkan Empire of 80 star systems, but it is smaller too, in a strange way.

Since there are only 21 areas for play, easy land grabbing by the players will be over in a hurry, and combat will arise quickly. The only practical difference as regards play, however, is that each sector contains massive numbers of stars, rather than a single system.

113019.name: The Spirit of Fighting
113019.description:
User Summary
The game portal includes character sheets, world descriptions, and a brief narrative, among other role playing necessities.

113020.name: Lot Lot
113020.description:
Tokuma Shoten published the game themselves on home platforms, including the Famicom. Additionally, they ported Capcom's sci-fi shooter Exed Exes to the Family Computer.

The player controls one arrow and has to move some pellets (which resemble Pachinko balls) from the upper cells (with a four-second delay) to the lower ones without having to confront an evil crab. He will grab the player's pellets and try to prevent the player from scoring with them by cutting the elastic. The crab is forced to leave the board if there are no pellets for him to find.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lot Lot", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113021.name: Mappy-Land
113021.description:
In this game, Mappy the Mouse has been given an extended family, including his wife, "Mapico the Mouse" and his son, "Junior the Mouse." However, Goro and his Mewkie thugs are back and trying to stop Mappy from making a new life. Mappy must survive through the levels collecting: Cheese for his girlfriend's (Mapico's) Birthday. Then Re-do them again but collecting rings for his wedding with Mapico. Then again collecting Christmas trees for the Christmas party. This time Mappy collects baseballs for his son's (Jr's) birthday. There are 4 worlds and 8 levels in each (A train station, The Wild West, an Island setting, a Jungle, a Pirate-ship, Graveyard, a Small Town, and a Giant Castle). Goro goes through many changes during the levels corresponding to the level Mappy is on.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mappy-Land", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113022.name: Dungeons and Dragons Chariot Racing
113022.description:
Introduction
A chariot race is well in keeping with the atmosphere of any evil D&D empire, and is usually played out before the annual Banquet, as a celebration of the peace of the Imperium, or after the Emperor has won a war, in celebration of his power. Chariot races can be held at any point at the discretion of the game master.

Using These Rules with D&D 3.5 or 4.0
The chariot race rules were originally written for Original Edition D&D, and its many clones, and work well, as is, with AD&D 1st edition and second edition. However, they can be used with editions 3.0, 3.5 and 4.0 perfectly well, simply by making this adjustment: Any saving throws or charioteering skill checks called for in these rules simply become Reflex saves made against a Difficulty Class of 15, and modified as listed.

The game master is, of course, free to allow a Chariot Driving skill in the game, and this should probably be done if the rules are going to be used on a regular basis. However, if such a skill is in play, the checks are made against a Difficulty Class of 20, instead of 15.

113023.name: Dungeons and Dragons Chariot Racing: Variant
113023.description:
Introduction
All, some or none of the following rules can be added into the D&D chariot race. Feel free to experiment, and use only the rules you like. Be aware, however, that these rules do change the strategy of the races.

Using These Rules with D&D 3.5 or 4.0
The chariot race rules were originally written for Original Edition D&D, and its many clones, and work well, as is, with AD&D 1st edition and second edition. However, they can be used with editions 3.0, 3.5 and 4.0 perfectly well, simply by making this adjustment: Any saving throws or charioteering skill checks called for in these rules simply become Reflex saves made against a Difficulty Class of 15, and modified as listed.

The game master is, of course, free to allow a Chariot Driving skill in the game, and this should probably be done if the rules are going to be used on a regular basis. However, if such a skill is in play, the checks are made against a Difficulty Class of 20, instead of 15.

113024.name: Popeye No Eigo Asobi
113024.description:
The game includes three modes: Word Puzzle A, Word Puzzle B, and Word Catcher. In Word Puzzle A (based on the first level of the original game), the player is given the Japanese term for a word in one of six categories: Animal, Country, Food, Sports, Science, and Others. Blank squares for the English word are given, and the player must maneuver Popeye around to point to letters of the alphabet in order to fill in the blanks. Each wrong letter entry prompts Brutus/Bluto to punch a basket carrying Swee'Pea; the player must solve the puzzle before Swee'Pea's basket is knocked off the platform it is attached to.

The player may also forfeit the puzzle by punching the "?" icon. If the puzzle is lost or forfeited, the correct English word will be displayed. Word Puzzle B is identical to the "A" mode; however, the player is not given the Japanese term beforehand. In the two-player Word Catcher mode (based on the third level of the original game), the first player controls Popeye and the second controls Bluto. Three Japanese words are displayed on the screen's left side, and both players compete to collect letters thrown by Olive Oyl to spell out their English equivalents. A player wins when he or she has correctly spelled five words.

Source: Wikipedia, "Popeye no Eigo Asobi", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113025.name: Sky Destroyer
113025.description:
The player's plane is equipped with machine guns and torpedoes and ammunition is unlimited. The colour of the sky changes according to the time of the day (afternoon, evening, night). F6F Hellcats are common enemy fighter planes the player will encounter. Occasionally, the player would run into a B-24 Liberator and has to shoot each of its four propellers before the B-24 flies away. Sometimes when player has shot down a number of B-24s, he or she would encounter a falling satellite across the screen. A high amount of points would be rewarded if the satellite gets destroyed.

Enemy resistance comes not only from the air, but from land and sea as well. Sometimes, an American naval destroyer or submarine would try to down the player's plane with AA fire. Aircraft carriers can sometimes be seen in the distant horizon (but can still be sunk with torpedoes). At the end of a stage, the player faces a mobile shore battery on an island. This battery must be destroyed in order to complete the mission.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sky Destroyer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113026.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 7 No 4 - Fall 2043)
113026.description:
User Summary

A second Fall issue. (The editor explains that there were some many good submissions that there were enough for an additional issue.)

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," The 10 O'clock News, Movie Releases, Dueling Ideas, Adventure: The Initiation, The World Championship Reports, Interview, Focus, The Showroom, Local Hero, Nuts and Bolts, Quotes, Combat Rock, The Last GenCon Article in this Issue, NOVA Awards, & Closing Fire.

113027.name: Warpman
113027.description:
User Summary

The Famicom-only sequel to Warp & Warp. You control an astronaut who has to warp between the Maze World and Space world to combat alien creatures. Space World plays like Robotron, while Maze World plays like Bomberman.

113028.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 7 No 5 - Winter 2043)
113028.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," The 10 O'clock News, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, Nuts and Bolts, 2043 Club Dueling Championship, 2043 Club Racing Championship, Duelslang, Quotes, Combat Rock, The Showroom, Tank Gun Efficiency, Cube Logs, & Closing Fire.

113029.name: MotoRace USA
113029.description:
The game's main character is a racer who must travel on his motorbike from Los Angeles to New York while avoiding many cars who try to crash into the rider.
Screenshot of the arcade version.

Interestingly, every level has two parts:

The first part is an overhead game with the aforementioned gameplay. Cars overtaken during this part of the level cause the player's rank to increment by 1 per car. The current rank is shown in the bottom right hand corner of the game screen during each stage.
The second part has the player watching the biker from behind his back. The player must try not to crash into the opposite cars while a background relative to the city he's travelling to is shown (i.e.: if the player is reaching Las Vegas, then a few casinos can be seen in the background). Oncoming cars passed do not increase the player's rank.

There are five different stages that the player encounters on their way to the final destination (NY) before the game starts back at stage one as outlined below. These stages alternate from tarmac on stages one, three and five, to unsealed (dirt) roads on stages two and four. On the tarmac stages bonus fuel can be picked up by running over the gas can icon. There is also a "wheelie" section which when run over causes the rider's bike to do a wheelstand and gain bonus points. On the dirt road stages both fuel and points can be gained by running over the gas cans or the score amounts indicated on the playfield. On the dirt road stage there are several log bridges that cross water and a "jump" section on some bridges - riding over the jump icon results in a score bonus. On all stages there are puddles of water which, if ridden through, render the bike unable to steer for a short period of time and a tyre squealing sound is played briefly.

Crashing into cars, road edges, bushes/trees, rocks or missing a bridge and riding into the water on a dirt road stage results in the motorcycle stopping and losing an amount of fuel. Running out of fuel causes the game to end. Crashing can also result (especially in later levels) in being overtaken by cars which decreases the player's rank.

As the player reaches each city the rank achieved results in a bonus amount being added to the score and extra fuel added to the player's total. The higher the position achieved the more points and fuel awarded.

When the player reaches NY, a sign saying "Viva NY" will be shown while the Statue of Liberty waves its hand and the Star Spangled Banner is played. After this cut-scene, the game starts again with an increased difficulty and the player has a higher capacity motorcycle (with correspondingly faster top speed).

Source: Wikipedia, "Zippy Race", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113030.name: Shrek 2: Beg For Mercy!

videogameversion.136582: North American Game Boy Advance edition

113030.description:
Box Description:

The tale of Puss In Boots

-Take on sword fights, acrobatics and combo attacks.

-Use a variety of cool moves to battle enemies.

-Play as Puss In Boots or one of his friends in over 20 levels.

113031.name: Spiral
113031.description:
Premise
The system is open: it’s just a frame of rules that will let you play in different environments. But you can’t just create any kind of adventures: the games created by "Spiral" will be tied to a very specific theme. This theme can be addressed by a couple of questions: "what can you lose to gain power?" and "what makes you human?" Combine the two questions and you’ll have the game. But you'll see better later.

113033.name: Spheres
113033.description:
Introduction
Known Space is divided into Spheres, which are autonomous governmental groupings of one or more settled star-systems. They differ widely in their wealth, style of government, power and size. Humanity has also encountered several sentient extraterrestrial species in its travels. Their psychologies have been quite alien to humans, though a couple of these races (the Hammerheads and the Starwhales) have proven to be useful allies to humanity. One of these races, though, the Tripods, was initially so hostile that their contact brought an almost immediate war that threatened the majority of humanity. As of 2221, the Tripod War has only been out of the picture for about six years.

113034.name: Sky Dancers

videogameversion.136587: North American Game Boy Advance edition

113034.description:
Box Description:

-Will you help the Sky Dancers save their dear Queen Skyla from the evil Sky Clone?

113035.name: Speed
113035.description:
Introduction
Strength - Presence - Ego - Education - Dexterity

SPEED Rules was written for players who are familiar with Role Playing Games, but want to generate a character quickly for a pick-up game, a spur-of-the-moment game with new friends or a new
campaign where concept is more important than volumes of special rules.

113036.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 8 No 1 - Spring 2044)
113036.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, Dueling Ideas, Nuts and Bolts, 2044 Vehicle Guide Update, Duelslang, Combat Rock, Quotes, The Showroom, Local Hero, State of the Art, 2044, Cube Logs, Movie Review, Closing Fire, & An Open Letter to Nova.

113037.name: Resnet's Spellbook
113037.description:
From the back cover:

In this follow-up to Morgenstern's Spellbook, we present over 70 new spells spanning 12 classes. Collected by the bard Resnet Morgenstern, sister to the great Rasmus Morgenstern, these spells represent her life's work as a collector of rare knowledge.

This book makes an excellent companion to Morgenstern's Spellbook, but stands equally well on its own.

Resnet's Spellbook works well as a "random" treasure item, the showpiece of an NPC's private library, or (broken into volumes) as the hook for an item-collection plot, especially when used in conjunction with Morgenstern's Spellbook. It is also an excellent source of a la carte spells to revitalize you campaign.

113038.name: SOUPS
113038.description:
Introduction
Why a game based totally on skills? In most other games you have a list of only a few stats. How can everything in life be accounted for by a few stats? The score in agility shows your ability to run, draw, juggle, and cheat at cards. How can these all be linked to one score?

People who are good jugglers are not necessarily good artists as well. So to fix this general ambiguity of abilities here it is, SOUPS, the skill based system. This system also trades complex rules for the long list of skills.
Another great thing about this type of system is its compatibility with any others.

113039.name: Sneak 'N Peek
113039.description:
Box Description:

Sneak 'N Peek is a one or two player hide and seek game designed to be played on the Atari Video Computer System or the Sears Video Arcade. There are four variations of the basic game and two levels of difficulty to increase your enjoyment and test your skill.

Sneak 'N Peek is played in and around a spooky old house with a large yard and three weird rooms. Each room, including the yard, is a separate scene, and contains up to five hiding places. Some of them are in really strange places, and some of the locations can change depending on the game you select.

The game always begins in the living room with player one standing in the corner and covering his eyes. Player two may sneak to any of the five hiding places in the living room or exit through the door to another scene. A timer keeps track of how long it takes the player to hide.

If a friend isn't available to play, the computer will be happy to hide from you. It knows all of the hiding places and is very sneaky.

113041.name: One of a Kind
113041.description:
Based on the popular game Crazy Eights, this lively card game delivers fast-paced fun while helping kids become aware of their unique and special qualities. Players draw, match, and shed cards, answering questions as they go. (For example: "Would you choose yourself as a friend? Why or why not?")

Because only half of the cards include questions, the game moves along at a brisk pace. Special cards--Switch Direction, Leap, and Wild Cards--introduce an element of surprise. Players race to get rid of their cards and be first to proclaim "One of a Kind." For added excitement, the rules provide a way for quick-thinking players to jump in at the last minute and keep the game alive.

After each round of play, smiles abound--because kids are not only having fun but also feeling better about themselves.

113042.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 8 No 2 - Summer 2044)
113042.description:
User Summary

"Aftermath Issue"

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, Lost and Found, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, Convention Reports, Return Fire, Nuts & Bolts, Revised Boat Construction Rules, 2044 Central Dueling Regional, 2044 Vehicle Guide Update, Duelslang, Combat Rock, Quotes, The Showroom, Local Hero, & Closing Fire.

113043.name: Stellar Reaches (Issue 17 - Autumn 2011)
113043.description:
Cover Art: The city of Bafq, Sashar system, dies in the aftermath of a Lucanic assault. War of the Rebellion, 100-1119 Imperial. The graphic is titled "Clouds of Ash" © Tuomas Korpi

From the Contents page:


Letter From The Editor
BITS Task System
Hegemony, Republic, Duchy: Part VI
Maps and UWP's for the Empty Quarter: 993, 1105, 1125, & 1201 Imperial
Hegemony, Republic, Duchy: Part VII
Supplement: Plans for the Hegemony and her Future
Maps and UWP's for the Empty Quarter: 1145 Imperial (Alternate)

113044.name: SOL (Version 2.1)
113044.description:
User Summary
The SOL rules, which may be used with any setting. SOL is distributed for free by Heraldic Game Design.

113045.name: Dream Palace (Beta)
113045.description:
Introduction
Before the Age of Television, the Dream Palaces ruled the Land of Entertainment. Week after week, Hollywood ground out celluloid fantasies for the masses. The people came into the large, ornate theaters to worship before flickering images of their favorite stars, to be informed by the newsreels, and laugh at the animated funnies.
But that was long ago. The Palaces have been replaced by hives of tiny cracker boxes. The Glamor of Hollywood has lost much, but not all, of its shine.
However, the Magic of the Movies still exists. There is the subtle thrill of descending into the dimly lit theater with a cold drink in one hand and popcorn in the other and being transported with everyone else in the theater to the dream that lights up on the silver screen.
Dream Palace is a game that allows you and your friends and family to create stories in the style of the movies.

113046.name: Space Invaders (N64)
113046.description:
Box Description:

Stop the alien invasion!

Battle squadron after squadron of alien forces as they pulse down through the menacing sky.

No time to stop! You can't look away!

The pressure's on: you've got a galaxy to save.

-Bonus version of Classic Space Invaders Hidden inside!

-Non-Stop action

Hunt through over 100 explosive 3-D levels for power-ups, hidden worlds, and a version of the classic arcade game.

-Menacing bosses

Test your rapid-fire skills against 13 enemy species and huge enemy bosses on 10 distant space worlds.

-Multiplayer alienfests

Play with a friend and go for the high score in two-player cooperative blast-a-thons.

113047.name: Slayer
113047.description:
User Summary
In Slayer, role players work together to battle monsters in a futuristic world of highly advanced technology.

113048.name: Spider-Man (2002 / GBA)

videogameversion.136606: North American Game Boy Advance edition

113048.description:
Box Description:

Bitten by a genetically engineered spider, high school student Peter Parker is suddenly empowered with supernatural abilities, including Spider-Sence, web-slinging and wall crawling. Assume the role of Parker as he adapts to his new powers and becomes Spider-Man. But beware-the city's villains won't be pleased to see a new hero on the scene.

-Defend the city from the clutches of evil with all-new combat moves and dizzying airborne acrobatics.

-Move through stunning scenes from the movie as you explore enormous city environments with newfound maneuverability.

-Battle the world's toughest villains, including Shocker, Vulture, and the Green Goblin.

113049.name: Danger Alliance: Battles
113049.description:
User Summary

Turn based strategy game. Two squadrons of five specialized soldiers move and shoot around the small gridded battlefield.

113050.name: Spider-Man 2 (2004 / GBA)

videogameversion.136608: North American Game Boy Advance edition

videogamehonor.29369: 2004 Golden Joystick PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee

113050.description:
Box Description:

Take New York for a spin.

Two years after becoming Spider-Man 2, you face your toughest enemy yet-the dangerous Doc Ock. Now the city of New York is relying on you to save it from his reckless rampage.

-Battle in scenes from the movie or pick your path and choose combat or stealth missions.

-Challenge classic villains including Mysterio, Lizard, Rhino, Shocker and Puma.

-Prowl a huge 3D New York as you unleash breathtaking new moves and combos.

113051.name: Spider-Man 3 (2007 / GBA)

videogameversion.136609: North American Game Boy Advance edition

113051.description:
Box Description:

Every hero has a dark side...

Unleash it.

-Master all-new combat movies.

-Battle New Goblin, Sandman, Venom and more.

-Wield the power of Black-Suited Spider-Man.

113052.name: Lux DLX 2

videogamehonor.32050: 2005 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee

113052.description:
User Summary

Tactical RPG similar to RISK with various maps. Includes Classic Touch, Castle Lux, Great Powers, King Arthur, and USA War Zone. Additional maps available for download.

113053.name: The Hard Way
113053.description:
Introduction
You believed in the american dream. You went to war thousands miles away to save your nation. You came home with nightmares,
trying to fit in. But you can't. And very soon you'll bring war back to the US.

All characters in the group know each other from the war. They were all part of the same squad.

113054.name: Super Tetris
113054.description:
Developed by Sphere, Inc. Added bombs, new special block types, and two-player co-operative and competitive modes.

Source: Wikipedia, "List of Tetris variants", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

113055.name: Heroes Blade
113055.description:
User Summary

Play cards representing "mana" to build up a field of minions to protect your defenses. Replenish your minions as they become eliminated while trying to eliminate your opponent's warriors. Unblocked attacks result in loss of HP. Player who ends up with zero HP loses.

113057.name: Keine Panik! Junior
113057.description: Image search under time pressure! For each question there is to find the called number of matching images. For example, "Find 4 pictures with something that has eyes" or "Find two images with a fish." Who is in it, gets all the playing pieces, and it will read a question. Then the timer is started, and the player tries to find as quickly as possible, the popular image maps. Accompanying photos are marked with a character. If all images have found, the timer stops. The remaining time is the points standings for the block. After four rounds the player with the most points wins.

113058.name: Donald Duck's Party Game for Young Folks
113058.description:
Donald Duck's Party Game for Young Folks is a "spin" and move game for young children.

The object of the game is to collect three prize tokens. The first player to do this is the winner.

The prizes are collected by moving the player pawns (four versions of Donald Duck) around the board by spinning a movement spinner until one player has landed on three "prize" spaces. The spinner is divided in to 4 quadrants numbered 1 to 4 with each one containing one square for each colored pawn that will determine the color of pawn to be moved and the number of spaces to move. While moving the player must read aloud what is written on the spaces as they pass them and perform any action that is in the space. For example "Stand up and take a bow" Once a player has landed on three prize spaces they are the winner. The winner must then do what the three prize tokens say.

113059.name: Dungeon Empires
113059.description:
User Summary

In Dungeon Empires players take on the role of a warrior aiming to build the most dangerous and feared dungeon.

One part of the game revolves around venturing out and raiding other player's dungeons too find creatures, rooms and other dungeon improvements. The player's character can be developed in tradition RPG fashion, including level-ups, stat points, various skills and equipment. Combat inside the dungeons is turn based but modified with a time component where some actions take longer so that enemies might get two turns instead of just one.

The other part of the game consists of building one's own dungeon. Players can place the looted rooms in their dungeon grid and connect them with hallways. Creatures can be added to fight intruders and various room improvements exist to bestow benefits to the creatures. Almost everything can be upgraded through magic runes (mostly obtained from disassembling unneeded items).

The game is free to play using a micro transaction shop to finance itself.

113061.description: Felix travels through Germany to visit many sights. Player plays a destination card and a kilometer card, shows his destination and its picture on the board and if the distance is lower than the kilometers you played, you set the card aside for a victory point. If there are other destinations en route, you can set them aside as well. Another player who has cards for destinations on that route can set them aside, too. When Felix is back in Münster and one player has played all his cards, the player with most cards wins.
113061.name: Mit Felix durch Deutschland

113062.description: Flocki and his doggy friends play at retrieving socks. Each player chooses a dog disc, the sock tiles are briefly displayed openly and then turned over. The active player rolls the die, this is the sock the dogs should retrieve. All players now look for this sock and place their dog disc as fast as the can onto the tile they think is the correct one. More than one disc is allowed on a tile, they are stacked. When all have placed their dog the tiles are turned over: If you did find the correct sock, you score chip points: 3 if you were the fastest, 2 if you were second and all others score 1 point. If you selected a wrong sock, you lose points. Then you switch 2 sock tiles. When all chips have been given out, you win with most points from your chips.
113062.name: Flocki such' das Socki!

113063.name: TSOY: The Shadow of Yesterday
113063.description:
User's summary:

The printed Polish translation with new artwork and revised content.

113065.name: Ein Tag wie kein anderer
113065.description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible finding correct answers
- geographic quiz, split into 3 phases, acting by turn -
phase 1
each player draws (randomly) a country card, memorizes data (as much as possible), localisates country and asks / answers questions
phase 2
each player rolls the die finding answers to selected questions regarding 'his country'
phase 3
each player determines by die a question card (world history) and faces the neighbour with a true/untrue questions

113066.description:
Seiji Kanai created the two-player abstract game RR – Regality and Religion – for a design competition with this restriction: "Create a game for 500 yen" (about $5). The game consists of 15 cards.

Both players start with a set of seven identical cards that act as pawns on a 3x3 board. Players take turns placing one of their cards in hand onto the board, with the card facing the active player. Some cards, when placed, rotate one or more of the surrounding cards upside down, making them face the other way; other cards destroy surrounding cards.

The game ends when the board is full, at which point the player with the most cards facing him wins.

Re-implemented by:

RRR – Regality vs. Religion: Revolution, an enhanced version of RR, comes in a box with a game board, card board tiles instead of cards, and eleven "neutral" tiles, five of which are randomly used in each game and available to both players.
113066.name: RR

113067.name: Mapominoes: Americas (N & S)
113067.description:
MAPOMINOES is the game that takes you to the edge of the world!

This portable game is fun, easy to learn, educational and highly addictive and makes a great present for any family member interested in geography or travel.

It’s like dominoes but with maps, as you build a map of the Americas, by connecting countries that share a common border. Stay one step ahead of your opponents, as you race to be the first player to play all your country cards on the table and win the game. Block your opponents by holding on to Mexico or Colombia or open up South America by playing Brazil. Take a boat through the Caribbean Sea to Cuba or transit by train through the USA to Canada. Try not to get stuck with Suriname, or miss a boat to the Bahamas as you watch the country cards spread across the table. The excitement builds as you have fewer and fewer cards left to play, but less space to play them in as you reach the edge of the world. (The table’s edge). Every country card is different due to their varying border connections and hence no two games are ever the same in this clever game that you will want to play again and again. Play as a stand alone game or combine with Mapominoes games for other continents to make to expand the game to cover the world. A simple game with hidden strategic depth that gives it broad appeal to both children and adults.

113068.name: Purpurklaue
113068.description:
(User summary)

Purpurklaue, the eighth module in DSA's T series, is set in the village of Bactrim, and deals with religious conflicts, mysterious disappearances, and a dark prophecy.

This promo module was available at selected conventions in 2011.

113069.description:
Objective: collect as many flowers as possible
- acting by turn -
roll the coloured die, choose one of those bees which where place previously onto flowers of the board,
if the flower shows the same colour take it and put the bee on another flower
113069.name: Die Farben Biene

113070.description:
In the far future, humanoid empires of the universe turned to an intense study of ancient civilizations that existed on a planet known as Earth. They learned that these ancients simultaneously built pyramids towards the sky and had an extensive knowledge of the stars. It was rumored that perhaps they were the original colonizers and space-farers of the first human age.

Now, at the edge of a colossal black hole, a pyramid-craft known as the Zoneplex has emerged with legendary markings and glyphs of the deep past. The known empires have sent their elite warrior-monk mystics on a one-way mission to gain control of the Zoneplex, to emerge victorious and ultimately control the pathways of the universe and time itself.

Zoneplex is a game that combines a tile-laying/exploration mechanism, a collaborative battle system and a zone control system to create an intriguing adventure in an alien pyramid.

The game works in 2 phases with the first phase players not counting Influence points until the pyramid is completed.

In phase 1 players strategically lay tiles determined by action cards to build their pathway through the Zoneplex pyramid whilst being cognizant of the Sacred Symbol card that they are bestowed with before the game begins. While building strategically players also confront creatures within the pyramid which they must collect to become worthy to enter the Eye and win the game. The players control the Zoneplex by gaining Influence points which occurs when a Player places a spirit-stone on the board. Spirit Stones not only sustain one's Influence points but can also be removed to gain bonuses in combat.

In phase 2 after exploring the pyramid, the players reveal their Sacred Symbol cards and count influence points, then a cutthroat race for survival and worthiness begins as players vie to enter "The Eye of The Zoneplex" to become the decisive winner or stand their ground with the most influence points as the action cards run out.
113070.name: Zoneplex

113071.name: Mein neues Leben
113071.description:
Objective:
get a job, acquire 50.000 € and own 3 friendship cards
- moving by turn -
you start as an emigrant, trying to get all neccessary tools like visa, job, vaccination, change of residence ...
moving around you must follow instructions on cards to be drawn
if you've finished 'preliminaries' you are allowed to fly to chosen country (change from outer to inner circle)

Now you have to make money, friends ...

113072.name: Kombi-Fix
113072.description:
Objective: be the first to get rid of all your chips
- acting simultaniously -
three dice with symbols . colour, circles and figures - are thrown
combine all of them and find correspondend picture on one of the boards
being the first you get rid of one of your chips to be placed upon that picture

113073.name: Chaos Effect: Godlike
113073.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chaos Effects: Godlike is a superheroic adventure campaign released for a general OGL & D20 Superhero system supplement introducing a major story event that greatly enhances a character’s super-abilities, with sobering consequences. In the early stages of the arc, the character appears to be in control of her new powers, or at the very least, capable of learning control, but as time wears on, the situation worsens. The character’s newfound abilities affect such profound change in her that her allies, even her closest friends, may no longer recognize her. As her powers continue to grow, her self-control dwindles, and her very humanity suffers. When, in a fit of madness, she steps over the line, using her newfound powers to commit some heinous crime, the other characters must decide whether their teammate is capable (or even worthy) of redemption. If you are looking to build an epic level adventure in the OGL & D20 genre, then this is the PDF for you. Best of all it is OGL and D20, so you can use it with the world most popular RPG rule set and should be easily compatible with any OGL and D20 Superhero genre based systems on the market today. This supplement includes:

What is "Chaos Effects": Using Godlike & Important Concepts
Chapter One - Preparing: Knowing the Players & the Characters
Chapter Two - Campaign Integration: Power Scale, The Premise, The Power, Power Use, Power Use - Ability Pool, Power Use - Narrative-Based Control, On Weaknesses & Storyline Phases-Plot Events
Chapter Three - Archetypes: The Receptacle, The Dark Half, Other Archetypes, Best Friend, Lover, Mentor, Rival
Chapter Four - The Nature of the Power: Naming Powers, Power Types, Sample Powers & Power Type, Cosmic Powers, Divine Powers, Elemental Powers and various others
Chapter Five - Non-Player Characters
Chapter Six - Adventure and Plot Hooks
Nearly 20 All New Feats

113074.name: Die Fußball Fibel
113074.description:
Objective: be the first to move each of your three tiles across finish line (centre of the board)
- acting/moving by turn -
roll the die and move - depending on area you land on you must draw a correspondent card (different topics)
if answer is correct move your tile one step into directon of the middle of the board (inner circles)
if you step on already occupied area opponent's tile is going to be moved back to start position if you win the fight (faster reply on question); the winning tile moves on into direction of the middle of the board

113075.name: Superline Gamemaster's Series: A Fistful of Plot Devices, #1
113075.description:
From Introduction:

Superheroes spend a lot of their active time responding to crises: something goes very wrong, and they must save the day. This is a collection of ways to create a crisis, including people, places, and things that can go wrong in interesting ways. They include some (real or impending) catastrophes, and also some basically positive developments that have nightmarish potential in the wrong hands. They’re each intended to provide reasons for lots of different kinds of heroes to feel like responding, suitable for use in many different campaigns. They aren’t complete adventures, but open-ended starting points.

113076.name: Crisis on Christmas (M&M2E)
113076.description:
From Introduction:

What the heroes hope to be a peaceful holiday season turns decidedly strange when Mr. Infamy threatens the beliefs and hopes of children across the world, by holding Santa Claus hostage! If something isn’t done, the world may be denied the hope and joy of the Christmas season.

Crisis on Christmas is a light-hearted holiday adventure for the Mutants & Masterminds Superhero RPG. It is intended for a group of four to six power level 10 heroes, although the Gamemaster can scale the adventure to make it suitable for higher or lower level heroes by increasing or decreasing the power levels of the challenges as appropriate.

113077.name: Bad Medicine
113077.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bad Medicine is an adventure from the Iron Age sourcebook, featuring drug deals and mercenary super-criminals. Do your heroes have what it takes to clean up the streets?

113078.description:
The frogs sing a lullaby to the princess. Some frogs, however, want to catch flies rather than singing and that's what you have to smuggle themselves into the choir and catch the other players in this smuggling. Each player place a card face down on the bed and says a spell or he doubts that all the frogs sing out really, who has cheated or who doubted wrongly loses a frog.
Player who has the biggest frog choir at the end of the game is the winner.
113078.name: Froschkonzert für die Prinzessin

113079.name: Con Season
113079.description:
From publisher blurb:

Con Season is a free Mutants & Masterminds adventure by D.T. Butchino. When the fans of Castle Comics convene for the popular CastleCon in Freedom City, they're in store for more than the average guest, as Doc Otaku decides to crash the con! Now it's up to the heroes to stop him and his mad plan, but what exactly is the anime-inspired mastermind up to?

113080.name: The Fight for Freedom City
113080.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fight for Freedom City is a free Mutants & Masterminds adventure by K.G. Carlson, originally written for the Origins 2007 convention. The Crime League is ready to make their move for control of Freedom City, but all is not as it seems and several prominent members of the Crime League are conspicuous in their absence - will the Freedom League figure out their nefarious plan in time?

113082.name: Charge of the Freedom Brigade
113082.description:
From publisher blurb:

Charge of the Freedom Brigade, a Mutants & Masterminds adventure by Christopher McGlothlin, is designed for six to eight Golden Age heroes in the power level 8 to 10 range.

This adventure is set in Freedom City at the start of America's involvement in World War II (described in the Golden Age sourcebook). It can, however, be used in the seaboard campaign city of the Gamemaster's choice simply by changing the proper names.

113083.name: Halloween Hijinks
113083.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween Hijinks is a collection of three short and spooky M&M mini-adventures by D.T. Butchino, intended for a group of four to six power level 10 heroes.

113084.name: Hate is a Four-Letter Word
113084.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hate is a Four-Letter Word is a free Mutants & Masterminds adventure by D.T. Buchino, intended for a group of four to six power level 10 heroes. What starts as a peaceful day in Freedom City slowly turns into a lesson in tolerance, as the heroes must defend the city from a hate-monger and his followers. Can the heroes stop him? Or will freedom become a word no longer associated with Freedom City?

113085.name: A Date That Will Live In Infamy
113085.description:
From publisher blurb:

Live In Infamy is an adventure from the Golden Age sourcebook, introducing heroes to the genre and period, plus it has a Nazi super-ape piloting a giant robot! What more could you ask?

113086.name: The Proteus Plot
113086.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Proteus Plot is a Mutants & Masterminds adventure run at Origins 2006. When the heroes of Freedom City confront agents of the Foundry, strange dreams trouble their sleep. Are they omens of a more sinister plot and, if so, what is Talos' latest scheme?

113087.name: Seed of Destruction
113087.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seed of Destruction is a free Mutants & Masterminds adventure by Steve Kenson. The plant kingdom is in revolt against Freedom City and its people. The Green Man and his Brides are behind it, but what's behind the sudden increase in the Green Man's power?

113088.name: Toys Will Be Toys
113088.description:
From publisher blurb:

Toys Will Be Toys is a Mutants & Masterminds holiday adventure: the heroes confront the schemes of the infamous Toy Boy, but it seems an old "playmate" of his has also returned to Freedom City looking for some fun. Can our heroes handle not one, but two terrible toymeisters?

113089.name: Fußballquiz
113089.description:
Every card has three questions about football in categories like players, clubs and matches on its frontside and answers on the backside. The Reader reads the questions and player who answers correctly first gets the card. If nobody answers correctly the card goes out of play. If all cards have played out, the player with the most cards is the winner

Contetns:
55 cards

113090.name: Druggies
113090.description:
It was only supposed to be a onetime deal to make a little extra cash. That was several years, countless deals, and a few arrests ago. Now you can't even imagine a life doing anything else. The money is too good to give it up. At least it was until someone started moving in on your territory.

Druggies is a flip toss game where each player takes the role of a drug dealer trying to get and sell drugs in an effort to be the first seller to reach the sales goal.

WHAT IS A FLIP TOSS GAME?

A flip toss game is a boardgame that uses a coin of some sort, instead of dice or cards, to determine different results during the course of the game. This is achieved by flipping a coin and trying to get it to land in a desired location on the game board.

113091.name: Jive Talka
113091.description:
From publisher blurb:

This tenth release in the series presents Jive Talka and his troublesome sidekick, Baby Brat. He's a bad mutha (Shut your mouth!) and she's his scary woman. They'll rock your campaign with more funk-filled crime than your heroes can handle!

113093.name: The Darkling
113093.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conquerer of his home dimension, the Shadow Hell, the Darkling now sets his eyes on ours. He and his nightmare minions come to steal the children of Earth and rob us of our mystic treasures. Do your heroes have what it takes to stop him?

113094.name: Darkling 2.0
113094.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conquerer of his home dimension, the Shadow Hell, the Darkling now sets his eyes on ours. He and his nightmare minions come to steal the children of Earth and rob us of our mystic treasures. Do your heroes have what it takes to stop him?

Revised for use with the new Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Darkling provides you with a pre-generated super-villain character to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used in a one-time appearance or as an ongoing super-villain, the Darkling has been statted at PL15, PL18 & PL20 to provide flexible use for any M&M superhero campaign.

113095.name: Hazmat 2.0
113095.description:
From publisher blurb:

In an attempt to hide from his Nazi past, Deitrich Schenk changed his name and became a master of medicine and robotics. Too bad a research accident infected him with an alien virus!

Can your heroes stop the infectious evil of this mad medical mastermind before he wreaks havoc on the world?

Created for use with the Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Hazmat provides you with a pre-generated super-villain character to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used as a recurring super-villain, or in a one-time appearance, Hazmat has been statted at PL8, PL12 & PL16 to provide flexible use for any teen, street-level, or standard superheroic M&M campaign.

113096.name: Informant 2.0
113096.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jessica Johnson is just your typical immigrant-American housewife trying to fit into a society that she wasn't born to. That is to say, she is if your typical housewife wields tremendous psychic powers and sells secrets to the highest bidder as a hobby!

Can your heroes stop the invisible mental machinations of the Informant?

Created for use with the Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Informant provides you with a pre-generated super-villain character to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used as a recurring super-villain, or in a one-time appearance, the Informant has been statted at PL7, PL11 & PL15 to provide flexible use for any psychic, street-level, or superheroic M&M campaign.

113097.name: Groß oder klein?
113097.description: The top card of the deck is turned over, the player guesses on his turn, whether the animal is larger or smaller on the next card. There are a total of nine delightfully drawn animals: mouse, dog, monkey, sheep, tiger, bear, horse, elephant and giraffe, and therefore is in the appearance of giraffe or the mouse does not rate very difficult, but with monkey, tiger and sheep it is not so easy to estimate. For correct answers you get small chips. 5 small chips are worth 1 large chips. Player with the 5 large chips wins the game.

113098.name: Gemini Fire & Gemini Ice 2.0
113098.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beautiful, deadly, metahuman. Three words that describe the twin elemental mercenaries known as Gemini Fire and Gemini Ice quite well.

These two villainous vixens will do anything to get what they want. Will your heroes stand in their way?

Revised for use with the Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Gemini Fire & Gemini Ice provides you with two pre-generated super-villain characters to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used as recurring super-villains, or in a one-time appearance, Gemini Fire & Gemini Ice have been statted at PL5, PL9 & PL9 to provide flexible use for any M&M superheroic campaign.

113099.name: Killjoy
113099.description:
From publisher blurb:

Raised to be a good man by his parents and taught to be a good soldier by his country, William Royce was on the way to fulfilling his own American Dream when a tragic accident killed his family and transformed his life. Now, as the murderous and ennui inducing Killjoy, he spreads terror and destruction wherever he treads.

It's up to your heroes to put a stop to his carnival of carnage!

Created for use with the Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Killjoy provides you with a pre-generated super-villain character to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used as a recurring super-villain, or in a one-time appearance, Killjoy has been statted at PL4, PL8 & PL12 to provide flexible use for any grim, 'realistic', or street-level M&M superheroic campaign.

113100.name: Ferrous Oxide 2.0
113100.description:
From publisher blurb:

Genetics made Paul Frassinetti a genius, family made him a criminal, and his own enourmous ego made him Ferrous Oxide, mastermind extraordinaire.

Can your heroes defeat this maleable master of magnetic mayhem?

Revised for use with the Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Ferrous Oxide provides you with a pre-generated super-villain character to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used as a recurring super-villain, or in a one-time appearance, Ferrous Oxide has been statted at PL8, PL12 & PL16 to provide flexible use for any M&M superheroic campaign.

113101.name: Ectoplasmic Man 2.0
113101.description:
From publisher blurb:

A career criminal and serial killer, Ernest Eggleston was sentenced to death and executed for his crimes but that didn't stop him; he has returned as the Ectoplasmic Man. Now he haunts the living and uses them to feed his dark urges.

Revised for use with the Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Ectoplasmic Man provides you with a pre-generated super-villain character to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used in a one-time appearance or as an ongoing super-villain, the Ectoplasmic man has been statted at PL5, PL10 & PL15 to provide flexible use for any M&M superhero or mystic campaign.

113102.name: Chaos Factor 2.0
113102.description:
From publisher blurb:

An alien miasma of unknown intellect or intent has fallen to Earth. Powerful and mysterious, it gives strange gifts of enormous power to dangerous individuals as it creeps among the human populace.
Can it be stopped?

Revised for use with the new Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Chaos Factor 2.0 provides you with three pre-generated super-villain characters, and one chaotic alien menace, to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used as a one-shot threat or an ongoing phenomenon, the Chaos Factor is designed to provide a flexible threat for any M&M superhero campaign.

113103.name: Bandito Rojo 2.0
113103.description:
From publisher blurb:

Torn from his place in history and imbued with super-abilities by the experimentation of his alien captor, Bandito Rojo escaped into a world that had forgotten him. Now he robs from the rich like some modern day Robin Hood (except for that whole giving to the poor thing; that's just not his style).

Revised for use with the new Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Bandito Rojo provides you with a pre-generated super-villain character to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used in a one-time appearance or as an ongoing super-villain, Bandito Rojo has been statted at PL5, PL10 & PL12 to provide flexible use for any M&M superhero campaign.

113104.name: Angrrl 2.0
113104.description:
From publisher blurb:

Estranged from her parents and taught by an overbearing aunt to hate men and the oppressive culture that they have created, Angrrl fights a never ending battle for gender supremacy. Gifted with super-human strength, an army of female followers (and useful certifications from several very reputable psychologists), Angrrl's crusade will rock your world!

Revised for use with the new Second Edition of M&M, Enemies A to Z: Angrrl provides you with a pre-generated super-villain character to drop into your campaign.

Designed to be used as a cameo appearance or an ongoing super-villain, Angrrl has been statted at PL10, PL13 & PL15 to provide flexible use for any M&M superhero campaign.

113105.name: Hero Express
113105.description:
Hero Express is a superhero re-theme of Arkham Express by David Willems.

Players will select one of the six included Heroes, or make your own, each with a unique special ability.

During a player's turn they will roll 5 Hero dice with unique symbols on each side, after rolling they have the option of re-rolling 3 more times.

If the "Villain" symbol is rolled on a die it is locked and cannot be re-rolled (unless the hero has an ability that allows it).

If 3 Villain symbols appear a new crime is reported and a new villain appears in Dark City.

The other sides of the dice include movement, Hero tokens (spent to use superpowers and items), recovery, and combat symbols (used when fighting the villains).

Capturing Villains allow the gathering of Justice Points, which are spent at a super secret location to purchase new abilities and items.

If at anytime there is 9 active crimes on the board, they Mayor will replace your team.

Each player must carefully choose how to use their abilities, items and hero tokens to thwart crimes and ultimately draw the Crimelord from hiding and defeat him.

Again I would like to thank David Willems for allowing me to create this re-theme, and for creating Arkham Express.

113106.name: rpgKids v1.5 - Adventure Pack 1
113106.description:
Get ready to embark on more adventures with your kids with the rpgKids Adventure Pack I for the rpgKids Role-Playing Game!

Included in this pack are four adventures that will take the young heroes to far off places and pit them against fearsome adversaries.

1. The Curse of the Sleepy Mist - The evil wizard Geleron has released a magical mist that has put the entire town of Springwell to sleep. Can the heroes of Springwell defeat him yet again and make everything right in Springwell?

2. Trixie the Unicorn's Rescue - The fairies of the Evergreen Forest need help, as their unicorn, Trixie, has been taken prisoner by the evil goblins of the Dark Swamp. Can the heroes of Springwell find her and bring her home to her fairy friends?

3. Rescue from Dinosaur Island - A group of explorers left on a boat to the mysterious Dinosaur Island but never returned. Can the heroes find them and bring them back home to Springwell?

4. The Pirates of Seaweed Cove - It seems pirates have been attacking ships off the coast of Springwell’s beach, teaming up with Shark‐Men from under the sea. Can the heroes stop the pirates and the Shark‐Men before everyone becomes too scared to go out on boats?

The pack includes all the maps and tokens you will need for your brave adventures.

A copy of the rpgKids roleplaying game is necessary to play through this adventure, along with a 12 sided and 6 sided dice. All maps needed are included in this adventure, and it uses the character tokens included in this adventure pack.

Gather the kids, bring out the dice and get ready to be the heroes of Springwell!

113107.name: Schmetterlingsspiel
113107.description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points (chips) as possible
- acting by turn -
place on any flower and stalk a red chip ( 1 bonus point)
place on any butterfly a green chip (2 bonus points)
roll the dice
phase 1
start on stalks ==> if your dice show matching numbers - take a red chip - if the chip was already taken off: bad luck
rolling a '2' or '5' double ==> take a butterfly - from the board or from another player
phase 2
if all red chips placed on stalks are reaped start with chips on flowers - same procedure as described above
game ends if all chips are harvested

1 board, 4 butterflies, 20 red chips, 4 green chips, 2 dice,
1 rule sheet

113108.description: This set of 4 dice was first given to all the supporters of the D-Day Dice Kickstarter project. The dice can be used to replace regular d6 when rolling for Machine-Gun Fire. Depending on the symbol shown, the MGF will make you lose different resources (lose 6 Soldiers when you roll a Skull). If you do not have the resource shown, you must automatically lose 6 Soldiers.
113108.name: D-Day Dice: MGF Dice

113109.name: Klaar Kiming
113109.description:
Objective:
get rid of your cards (places to visit) and reach Bredstedt at the end
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll and Move' game
choose the best route to discard your cards
if you land on a 'chance' field follow instructions
if you land on a place you possess a card of ==> answer a question drawn by another player - if you succeed, discard it
if not - discard the previous card but draw a new, additional card;
in this way you learn more about 'Frisia', a northern part of Germany
rules, cards and map are printed in German and Friesian

113110.name: Ein unbegabter Liebhaber
113110.description:
Objective: get on your (male) feet, find a proper lady and be the first taking her home (doesn't matter if it is her or your home)
- moving by turn - 'Roll and Move'
4 ladies are waiting to be caught (sorry: married) but board and rules are made to create a bit confusion and trouble
the way to find a lady can be easy - roll and move but
taking her home (depending on colours) is difficult because
appropriate cards must be drawn & instructions followed;
opponents are waiting to pinch your lady - much easier than
choosing detours - or to change ladies, if the their way home seems be faster/shorter

113112.name: Gestalt: The Hero Within Player's Guide (M&M 2E edition)
113112.description:
User summary:

Information from Gestalt: The Hero Within (M&M 2E edition) that would be available and useful for players only.

113113.name: Der Eismann   Ötzis Reise durch die Zeit
113113.description:
Objective: become the wealthiest stone age man
- acting/moving by turn -

Phase 1:
Collect as many property cards as possible ==>

don't marry too often - you must feed them all
avoid wolves and bears
make reasonable deals on stone age markets
find correct answers for drawn questions cards
try to get copper - the most precious good
make well elaborated moves




if you think that you prepared yourself well ==>
Phase 2

be the first crossing the glacier (surviving!)
getting a big bonus - all property is going to be calculated ==>




Resulting in winning the game

113114.name: Halt Evil Doer!
113114.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the world of Heroic Earth. It’s a planet of costumed crusaders with amazing powers, villains with unbelievable might, and all of the conventions of comic book heroism. Because of the flexibility and diversity of the system, we’ve chosen to use the M&M Superlink game rules for this setting. We believe it will work best for establishing the mood we want for our setting.

113115.name: Ancient Rules
113115.description:
This is a set of rules designed for use with 6mm or 2mm strips of figures, though other figure scales could be used if desired. Two different basing systems are suggested: 1) where units are comprised of multiple strips with strips being removed when casualties are taken, or 2) units are made of 1 or 2 strips, with unit strength tracked with a roster or with casualty markers.

Units are defined in terms of battlefield purpose (battle unit, auxiliary, skirmish, and other), and unit grade (elite, veteran, average, and raw).

113116.name: Micro Squad: The 1:1 Scale Game
113116.description:
Based on the popular Micro Armour: The Game - WWII platoon scale rules, Micro Squad: The 1:1 Scale Game - WWII is designed for both the history buff and the 6mm wargamer. Training, experience, and "cohesion" of players' forces are important factors in deciding the outcome of each battle.

The rules include:


23 pages of weapons and aircraft data for the US, UK, France, Poland, Soviet Union, Germany, Italy, and Japan.
Full color game markers
Quick reference Combat Table Card
How-to guide for designing scenarios
10 ready-to-play scenarios


GAME SCALE: 1 miniature = 1 vehicle/weapon/infantry squad, 1 inch = 25 yds/meters, 1 turn = 1 real time minute

113117.name: Klikwerk
113117.description:
Remove all the items as quickly as possible, by pointing, clicking, dragging, dropping and hitting the spacebar, as you are told ...

Source: The Developer Website.

113118.name: Project Mindwar
113118.description:
From publisher blurb:

Project Mindwar details five new super-villains for your M&M campaign, all escapees from a top-secret research lab devoted to developing military psychics. Mentally disturbed but dangerously powerful, they use their diverse powers to commit crimes as varied as assassination, drug running, airborne hijacking and going AWOL. Project Mindwar may have been cancelled in the wake of their escape, but one thing remains certain - these are some dangerous minds you don?t want to encounter.

113119.name: OMNI-Database Primer
113119.description:
From Introduction:

Established in 1937 by Professor Stephen Barrington, the OMNI-Database was initially conceptualized as a research tool for those working in the burgeoning field of super-human studies. In 1943 Barrington was commissioned by the US government to expand the contents of the database as part of Project Overwatch, an early task-force devoted to curtailing the rise of criminal masterminds and super-humans who had appeared during the early days of the decade.

The database survived the decommissioning of Project Overwatch in 1957, becoming the basis of the independent super-human studies center known as OMNILabs. Since that time OMNI-Labs has maintained the Database as an independent entity, leasing its contents to the US State Department, the secret service and international law enforcement agencies such as Interpol in exchange for the opportunity to study and catalogue the powers of captured criminals.

The OMNI-Database is a comprehensive listing of every super-powered being and advanced technology that has been encountered since the 1940s. Maintained by a powerful A.I program and stored in a heavily fortified structure deep in the Nevada desert, it is the most complete listing of superhuman powers and activities known to mankind.

A less comprehensive version of OMNI is also available for private use, often accessed by independent super-heroes, corporations and super-hero fans to get the latest information about the meta-human world. An individual with access to the internet and a credit card can search the database by name or code name, key word, costume, power or any of a hundred other qualifiers, performing a rapid survey of the eight hundred thousand entries in OMNI’s databanks.

113120.name: San Angelo: City of Heroes 1.5
113120.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Origins Award-nominated San Angelo: City of Heroes -- the book that Ken Hite called "the very model of the superheroic city book" and Kurt Busiek (Astro City) called "an intricate, involving, well-realized gaming world" -- comes to you with M&M Superlink and Action! System character stats!

Contains 174 pages of incredibly rich source material, detailing the fictional city of San Angelo, the City of Heroes.

An entire superhero campaign setting in one book! A sample hero team, supervillains, and dozens of personalities that the PCs are likely to interact with in the course of every game!

113121.name: Super Powered Adventure Planner
113121.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the one thing that all GMs are going to have to have, if they are planning to run adventures in OGL & D20 Superhero systems and genres. Super Powered Adventure Planner includes any and all forms you will need to run adventures and keep order. The Super Powered Adventure Planner contains the following forms:

Campaign Overview: Including Published PDFs or Sourcebooks Used & Changes to published setting
Important Events in the Campaign History
Location in the Campaign
Character Archetypes and Templates: Standard and Various others
Combat Round Check & Player Condition
Recent Campaign Events
Campaign Rogues Gallery & Supporting Cast List
Adventure Outline & Planned Scenes
