Ways to Play: Collect all four cards with the same initial sound or looking for pairs. Player who has most sets or pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

113250.name: Nancy Drew: The Mystery of the Clue Bender Society
113250.description:
From the back of the North American DS case

The Tenacious Teen Sleuth Faces Her Biggest Mystery Yet!

During her initiation case to gain entry into the prestigious Clue Bender Society, Nancy is swept up in an alarming theft snowballs into a dramatic whodunit. With only 24 hours to secure her membership and unravel the mystery, Nancy will have to be at the top of her game!

New snowmobile and boat play lets Nancy thoroughly explore the Clue Bender's Island.

Play through 9 intriguing chapters filled with sleuthing and secrecy.

Use Nancy's new fingerprint identifier to discover hidden clues.

113251.description:
(User summary)

A promo card for use with Chez Geek with the following attributes:

Aktivität
Slack 1W6
Kosten 2

Pegasus promo card #02
113251.name: Chez Geek: Promokarte Poker

113252.description:
The Battle of Lobositz, October 1st, 1756
This was the first field battle between the Austrians and the Prussians in the Seven Years War.
When it became clear to Frederick the Great (Friedrich II of Prussia) that Marie Therese of Austria was building a coalition of nations to attack him, he decided to strike first. He invaded Saxony, trapping its army and knocking it out of the coalition. An Austrian army under General Browne rushed up into Saxony to try and drive out the Prussians and rescue the Saxons.
The two armies met at Lobositz.
Postcard game using one sheet for the map, few counters and easy rules.
With additional scenario and optional rules. A Must Have !
Suitable in solitary play.
113252.name: Battle of Lobositz, October 1, 1756

113253.name: Avalyn Adventure #9
113253.description:
user summary

Six adventure seeds for the DCS RPG.

113254.name: G.I. World War II Tactical Combat
113254.description:
Rules for skirmish combat during the Second World War.

Game Scale:
1 turn = 1 minute in terms of movement
1 figure = 1 vehicle or soldier (in general)
1 inch = 15 meters

Opposing forces are divided into two to four tactical groups (units) either by the players or based on scenario rules. Units are activated one at a time during the random activation process. Units are composed of one or more formations (squads, weapons sections or vehicles) and formations are composed of one or more figures. Recommendation is no more than four units per side to control the size and pace of the game. Each unit will be represented by a marker (a playing card, marked poker chip, or specially prepared index card) during the activation process.

A turn is comprised of 4 phases:
1. Artillery
2. Mark figures conducting supressive fire
3. Activation phase
4. Remove markers

113255.name: Buffy The Vampire Slayer: Sacrifice
113255.description:
This action-packed 3D survival horror game sees Buffy using a range of special weapons, powerful spells and martial arts to take out vicious vampires and demons.

In addition to these enemies, players also come across recognisable characters from the show, including Spike, Angel, the Master, the First Evil, Caleb and, of course, the Scooby Gang.

Features

- Play as Buffy the Vampire Slayer through 24 levels using a third person camera.
- Unlock and use more than 20 types of unique Slayer weapons.
- Fight more than 12 different level bosses and sub-bosses, including First Evil, the boss of all bosses.
- Play “Challenge Mode” in first-person for fast-paced action and an increased difficulty level.
- Solve puzzle missions to unlock new areas.
- Collect spells to increase Buffy’s supernatural and physical abilities.
- Explore 12 dynamic environments and search for up to four hidden ones.

Source: The Publisher Website.

113256.name: Cats and Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
113256.description:
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore is a hilarious action-platforming game that draws upon the high-tech gadgetry and high-stakes espionage as cats and dogs join forces to save themselves, and their humans.

Play as Seamus, Diggs or Catherine and visit locations in the film such as Dog HQ, Alcatraz and Playland Amusement Park as you try to defeat the The MacDougals, Paws and Kitty Galore in exciting boss battles!

- Over 45 missions with 7 different mission types
- Run, jump and fly your way through levels and obstacles
- Use high-tech gadgets to help you on your way—including devices from the movie and a few extra surprises

Source: The Publisher Website.

113257.name: Camping Mama: Outdoor Adventures
113257.description:
Mama’s back with an exciting outdoor adventure!

Mama and her family have gone camping on Adventure Island. With 100’s of outdoor mini-games, 38 stages with various traps and quests there is so much treasure to find with Mama and Papa.

Collect insects, fish, animals and all manner of creepy crawlies to complete your family camping picture book!

Features

- Adventure Mode: 5 areas on Adventure Island and 3 levels of difficulty.A variety of outdoor tasks to complete including
- Cooking: Peel bananas, grill fish, cut mangoes or grill clams on the barbecue
- Making: Make a spider catcher, craft a net, make a lei or build a bonfire
- Action: Catch a fish, cut down a tree, pick some flowers or shoot fruit with a slingshot
- Answer: Identify jungle objects, count the ladybird’s spots!
- Base Camp: Decorate your camp with treasure you’ve found.
- Collect items and create your own camping picture book.
- You can swap characters and play as Ichigo or Ringo
- Decoration Mode: You can change all the characters clothes.

Source: The Publisher Website.

113258.name: Diva Girls: Diva Dancers
113258.description:
It’s all in the beat.

The Diva Girls are heading to the bright lights of Fiesta City ready to bust some moves and enter the greatest dance competition in the world.

It’s not going to be easy though and along the way they must face-off against B-boys, bullies, princesses and showgirls.

If they make it through then the girls must take on the hardest challenge of all and compete against each other –will their friendship survive?

Features

- Touch-screen rhythm action
- New steps and moves
- 14 locations, each with their own champion dancer to defeat
- New music to dance to
- Story mode, quick play and multiplayer modes
- Challenge your friends to a dance-off

Source: The Publisher Website.

113259.name: Diva Girls: Making the Music
113259.description:
In this new instalment of the Diva Girls, the four friends take a break from dancing to music and start making it themselves!

After rehearsing hard, the girls are given their big break when a local band invites them to join them on tour.

But will new girls Surya and Chandra become pop pals or rock rivals? Plus, is love in the air for one of the girls and can she concentrate on her music?

Features

- Four instruments (guitar, bass, keyboard and drums) to master
- Great new storyline featuring the Diva Girls in an all-new musical adventure
- Unlock new outfits and instruments
- The more the audience applaud, the better your girl will look
- Eight new arenas to play in from an open-mic night to the spectacular arena tour

Source: The Publisher Website.

113260.name: Fashion Designer: High Fashion
113260.description:
Zoe returns with more fashion tips in the sequel to the best-selling Fashion Designer: Style Icon.

Fashion is even more fun, with Fashion Designer: High Fashion. Significant feature improvements to the well-loved original deliver a deeper experience for every wannabe Zoe.

The player once again takes on the role of the young fashion designer who creates clothing for a host of customers and to ensure she’s famous and successful in the glamorous world of haute couture.

Features

- our appealing characters, each with their own characteristics
- Use your design portfolio to collect designs you have created
- Revised 3D tailoring tools for better control
- More varied tailoring missions, from creating handbags, hats and accessories to emergency surgery on a moth-infested teddy bear
- Upper screen displays important information when tailoring
- Dynamic music, new zoom/turn function and your final clothing result is represented on an animated 3D model

Source: The Publisher Website.

113261.name: Fashion Designer: Style Icon
113261.description:
Taking the role of a young woman who wants to conquer the world of fashion, you start as an apprentice in a small fashion workshop.

Compose the pattern of your cloth, select the fabric, and tailor your clothes with the stylus, from cutting out, sewing and ironing up to sewing the buttons creating stunning outfits for catalogues, movie posters, mail order companies stars and VIP’s.

After each mission, present your creations in catalogues, movie posters and on the catwalk, where you can choose your models, hairstyles and creations.
Your performance will be rated according to tailoring time, fashion choices, and accuracy as you attempt to advance your career on the way to becoming the world‘s most famous fashion designer.

But beware of the arch enemies of each fashion designer: Clothing moths! Led by the charismatic General Gothmoth, the moths will do anything to cross your plans and to steal fabric: Air attacks, "submarine" attacks under the fabric, moths disguised as ladybugs, moth squads hid under thimbles or inside socks, attacks with spider-grapples to pull fabric off-screen, even "naval" attacks with paper boats - the general invents always new strategies to loot precious fabric... It's up to you to find out how to defend against the different moth tactics.

Features

- Use the DS stylus to create your clothes, from design to the catwalk
- Learn the basics of fashion design and tailoring
- Tailor your clothes with the stylus, using scissors, hands, iron, sewing machine and needle
- Complete your models’ look with accessories, hairstyles and makeup
- Use career mode to become the world‘s most famous fashion designer
- Create clothes at any moment in free mode, and unlock new free mode missions in career mode
- Beware of the moths which try to steal fabric, and find out how to defend against various moth tactics
- Meet the clever moth commander General Gothmoth, possibly the smallest super villain ever seen

Source: The Publisher Website.

113262.name: HOP
113262.description:
Based on the storyline from HOP the movie, blending state of the art animation with live action, HOP tells the comic tale of Fred, an out of work slacker who accidently injures the Easter Bunny (E.B.) and must take him in as he recovers.

Play through the various challenges in this puzzle adventure to help Fred and E.B. evade the Pink Berets and progress through the levels.

Features

- WACKY WEAPONS– battle through legions of chick workers and the highly trained Pink Berets with an arsenal of fantastical candy-themed weapons – including chocolate super soakers, gumball shooters and cotton candy cannons.
- 3D MOVIE LOCATIONS – Play through actual 3D locations from the film – from Hollywood all the way to Easter Island!
- ROCKSTAR MODE – Help E.B. realise his dreams of becoming a famous rock ‘n’ roll drummer in Music Mode.
- MINI GAMES – Snatch moving bunny targets, go bowling for candy and embark on an epic Easter egg hunt!

Source: The Publisher Website.

113263.name: Hotel For Dogs
113263.description:
Hotel for Dogsstars Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, in a smart, funny comedy adventure that shows how far love and imagination can take you.

When 16 year old Andi (Roberts) and her younger brother Bruce (Austin) find themselves in a foster home with a strict “no pets” policy, Andi has to use her quick wit to help find a new home for their dog, Friday.

The kids stumble upon an abandoned hotel and begin transforming it into the perfect home for Friday –as well as all the strays in the city.

In no time, the kids have transformed the old hotel into something truly magical: a home for both the dogs and for themselves.

Features

- Follow the adventures of Andi and Bruce from the movie
- Find items in the hotel to build amazing gadgets for the hotel
- Manage your hotel as well as its furry guests
- Unlock exciting new levels and mini games
- Play alongside the stars of the movies -including the four legged friends

Source: The Publisher Website.

113264.name: I Did It Mum!
113264.description:
A collection of fun and educational minigames aimed at pre-school children, I Did It Mum features 12 minigames inspired by classic pre-school books and games

There are two versions of I Did It Mum! - one for boys and one for girls.

The two versions have a different selection of mini games designed to appeal to sons and daughters alike, with the boy version featuring games like “toy train” or “drive the car”, and the girl version offering games like “colour the animals” or “little kitchen”.

I Did It Mum offers simple but fun challenges for this age group, which they can enjoy completing with along side a parent or alone.

An additional feature allows for a voice recording option for Mum to encourage their child when playing by themselves.

Features

- Simple, fun and safe minigames.
- Brightly coloured illustration style graphics.
- High level of interaction to keep attention
- Suitable for young pre-school aged boys/girls.
- Can be played by parent and child together.
- Encourages your children to interact and develop skills with the encouragement of their parent.

Source: The Publisher Website.

113265.name: I Did It Mum! 2
113265.description:
I Did It Mum! returns with a series of simple games specifically designed to stimulate learning in very young children.

I Did it Mum 2 allows the parents to play and enjoy Nintendo DS together with their children, teaching them numbers, letters and shapes in a fun and unique way.

I Did it Mum 2 is available in Boy version and in Girl version.

Features

- New pet companion: cat, dog or chick 18 different mini games, with 5 of them exclusive to each version (boy, girl)
- 14 brand new mini games
- Birthday recording function. Up to 6 birthday/memorial dates can be recorded and each one can be associated to a person
- Fully controlled via touch screen
- Boys edition also available

Source: The Publisher Website.

113267.name: I Did It Mum! Spelling
113267.description:
Spelling can be fun!
I did it Mum: Spelling is designed to help 4-7 year olds develop essential skills in spelling, handwriting, reading, alphabet and keyboard skills in a fun and engaging way.

Hosted by a cool puppy character this game is designed to be entertaining whilst having an educational grounding supporting your child's language development. There are over 300 words to learn and master along with fun mini games to develop and reward their found new skills.

Features

- 300 hundred words for your child to master

- Mini-games which develop spelling, handwriting, reading, alphabet and keyboard skills

- Hosted by fully animated puppy character with full VO that encourages and guides your child through the games

- Sticker Book feature to reward continued play

Source: The Publisher Website.

113268.name: I Did It Mum! Doll's House
113268.description:
The first interactive dolls house game!
Playing as Emily the doll, you must help mum and dad out around the house. Whether you are feeding the fish, laying the table or running a bath for your baby brother, there are lots of things to be done!
Complete the chores that mum and dad ask you to do but don’t forget to have fun playing too! Be sure to keep Emily’s family happy, healthy and wealthy and you will be able to choose new items for the Doll’s House and re-decorate!

Features

- First interactive Doll’s House game
- Fully customizable Doll’s House, decorate every room!
- Gold-star achievement board
- Over 40 mini-games and 11 rooms to unlock and explore
- Day and night time structure
- Fun and easy pick up and play style game with an open-ended game-play experience
- Learn educational facts!

Source: The Publisher Website.

113269.name: I Did It Mum! Picture Book
113269.description:
I Did it Mum: Picture Book is a spin-off of the successful I Did it Mum! series and features 8 fully voice recorded story books.

The game contains entertaining traditional tales taken both from Europe and Asia, and also offers a selection of fun mini games.

I Did it Mum: Picture Book is a fun and educational way to introduce children to books.

Features

- 8 picture books with traditional stories
- Bonus mini games
- Voice can be muted so parents can read to their children
- Interactive illustrations to stimulate and excite children’s curiosity
- Language options include English, Spanish, French, Italian and German

Source: The Publisher Website.

113270.name: Johnny Test
113270.description:
Based on the global hit TV series Johnny Test chronicles the adventures of a fearless 11 year old boy, his genetically engineered super talking dog Dukey and his 13 year old super genius scientist twin sisters, Susan and Mary, who use Johnny as their guinea pig for their out-of-this-world scientific experiments.

Johnny’s sisters dressed up their beloved Gil as a princess, but now he’s been captured by the jealous Bling-Bling Boy.

What’s worse, Brain Freezer and Mr. Whacko have managed to get involved. As usual, it’s up to Johnny and Dukey to save the day.

Features

- Play as 3 different versions of Johnny Test.
- Run, jump and shoot your way through 12 different missions with a laboratory’s worth of gadgets and power-ups.
- The humour continues with hilarious parodies of classic video games.

Source: The Publisher Website.

113271.name: Kira Kira Pop Princess
113271.description:
Kira Kira Pop Princess brings music, dance, fashion, rhythm and much much more to the DS!

Kira Kira Pop Princess is a music rhythm game that immerses the player in the world of Gaby as she learns the moods, styles and rhythms of Rainbow City, the city of fashion and music.

Players guide Gaby through the many districts of Rainbow City as she dances her way ever closer to her dream of becoming as popular as Anna, the Rainbow City ‘Dance Queen’.

Rainbow City is built from many different districts, each with its own style and musical influences. In each, Gaby will meet a local girl who shares her dance passion and has a distinct fashion style and musical taste and by challenging and beating these locals in dance competitions, Gaby can unlock their fashion styles for her own wardrobe and dance on to new districts.

Challenging yet engaging gameplay and intuitive dance controls create a fun and exciting music rhythm game. Many customisation options including new tops, skirts, shoes, hairstyles and accessories, allow Gaby to change her look throughout the game whilst travelling, creating her own fashion styles.

Features

- Dance with the DS
- Build the powerful Rainbow combos
- Story Mode adventure
- Unlock new mini games
- Buy new clothes and more
- Cute characters and cartoon graphics
- Challenge and beat friends in multiplayer mode

Source: The Publisher Website.

113272.name: Maths Made Simple
113272.description:
Based on a book written by the Japanese professor Susumu Sakurai, Maths Made Simple is a "brain training" style game where you learn an original learning method enabling easy calculation of math problems.

Mini games and a special 'hint' mode offer interesting suggestions on how to solve everyday math problems more simply.

Features

- Learn simple and fun ways to perform complex calculations
- Lesson mode with 17 different calculation methods
- Choice of game play modes: lesson, quiz, drill and skill exam etc
- Ambling Arithmetic's mini game, an endurance mode to check your true maths skill
- 9 different costumes for the main character: professor, magician, explorer etc
- Hint mode will suggest how to use maths effectively in everyday life

Source: The Publisher Website.

113273.name: Digital Hero (Issue 44 - Jul 2007)
113273.description:
User Summary

In this issue: When Last We Left Our Heroes, HEROGlyphs, You Gotta Have Character, Generic Characters, Migrating from d20 - Part II, & Viva Muerte.

113274.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 9 No 2 - Summer 2045)
113274.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, Movie Releases, Convention Calendar, Nuts & Bolts, Murphy's Corner, 2045 Vehicle Guide Update, Quotes, Duelslang, The Showroom, Cube Logs, & Closing Fire

113275.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 9 No 3 - Fall 2045)
113275.description:
User Summary

"One Crazy Summer"

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, Movie Releases, Convention Calendar, Nuts & Bolts, GenCon '95 Report, 2045 Vehicle Update, Quotes, Duelslang, 2046 NOVA Club Racing Championship, The Showroom, Cube Logs, The Man Behind The Monster: Godzilla's Smarter Brother Speaks Out, & Closing Fire.

113276.name: Blend-It
113276.description:
Blended is an exciting new puzzle game all about mixing colours. The goal of the game it to clear the screen by linking together colours with the same tone.

You can mix colours together creating new tones to help you clear the screen and using a colour wheel in the top screen you can see what colour you will create.

A host of single modes and multiplayer challenges will test your mixing skills to the limit.

Features

- 5 different game modes: Freehand, Quickdraw, Practice, Painter and Puzzle
- Multiplayer versus mode and game sharing support
- User friendly interface
- Easy to pick up hard to master

Source: The Publisher Website.

113277.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 9 No 4 - Winter 2045)
113277.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," Geoff & Greg's Question Corner, 10 O'clock News, Movie Releases, Convention Calendar, Murphy's Corner, Nuts & Bolts, 2045 Vehicle Guide Update, Quotes, The Showroom, 2045 NOVA Awards, Cube Logs, & Closing.

113278.name: Big Word Puzzle Book
113278.description:
Published by 505 games, Big Word Puzzle Book is a game designed to appeal to a broad audience, the same composite audience that surged on the video game market scene following titles such as Brain Training and 42 All-Time Classics. Big Word Puzzle Book builds from that experience by getting people's pre-existing shared knowledge and skills into play. In this case, it's all about language skills.

Big Word Puzzle Book is in fact an interactive word puzzle book that comprises both original and classic games, and further improves player's experience by combining the games into a structure that adapts to its users’ playing patterns. Also, Big Word Puzzle Book makes the most out of the natural interface offered by Nintendo DS and offers a staggering amount of content for long-term enjoyment.

Source: The Developer Website.

113279.name: Mindstorm 2
113279.description:
Mind, Body & Soul: Mindstorm 2 is the sequel to the popular NDS game of twisted mental puzzles that utilises all four corners of the brain, from logic puzzles to analytical conundrums.

Mindstorm 2 contains multiple puzzle types across a variety of genres, with ever increasing difficulty levels to give fans of Brain Training games even more to think about..!

Features

- Four genres of mind games incorporating memory, endurance, logic and analysis

- Test your memory and mental endurance

- Three puzzle types per genre with a total of 12 games and five difficulty levels

- Five of the seven puzzles are automated providing an infinite number of games

- The other puzzles have a minimum of 100 questions each.

- You can change your mental avatar by collecting bonuses

Source: The Publisher Website.

113280.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 10 No 1 - Spring 2046)
113280.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, The World Out There, 10 O'clock News, Murphy's Corner, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, Nuts & Bolts, 2045 NOVA Club Championship Report, DKI Corporate Challenge: Duel or Deathtrap?, Duelslang, Quotes, Cube Logs, & Closing Fire.

113281.name: Master Jin Jin's IQ Challenge
113281.description:
Mindstorm is designed to be truly enjoyable, while at the same time aiming to stimulate and develop the brain through a series of mini games.

Players will enjoy playing the challenging mini games while developing the powers of thinking, utilising their existing knowledge and experience. This game transforms basic curiosity into powerful thinking.

Features

- 10 games featuring varying questions on a wide variety of subjects
- In the Personal Record Screen, you can check the status of your current brain level
- Dual benefit of being fun and entertaining while training the mind.
- Thoughtfully selected problems and stimulating graphics
- A large quantity of data not found in other similar games
- Adjust the questions according to the skill level of the player providing enjoyable game play in any situation

Source: The Publisher Website.

113282.name: My Pet Dolphin
113282.description:
Make a splash with your underwater friends.

My Pet Dolphin tasks younger gamers with raising and nurturing their very own water-bound buddy, schooling them up on stunning tricks and performing to the crowds to rapturous applause.

Using the stylus, trainers are able to directly interact with their new Dolphin friends. This includes playing simple ball games, feeding them with the right foods at the right time and stroking their heads to reward improvement in ability. The dolphins will react positively or with a degree of reticence depending on how you choose to communicate with them.

Once your new friend is onside, it’s time to work out some tricks and routines. The performances in the pool in front the crowds let you know how much your dolphin has improved. Watch their reactions to judge how well your training has gone!

Features

- Using your DS stylus teach your dolphin tricks and routines.
- Skills are assessed by reactions of audience and score board.
- Realistic scenery and time changes: blue sky - sunset - night view.
- Includes a 'Did you know section?' about dolphins and whales.

Source: The Publisher Website.

113283.name: My Pet Dolphin 2
113283.description:
My Pet Dolphin 2 builds on the success of its predecessor and offers a whole new game play experience.

This time you play a baby dolphin and follow him on a series of adventures as he learns new tricks and gains confidence living in his new open sea environment. New additions also include an album mode to check your collected items, a flower growing mode and all new mini games.

Features

- Mission mode filled with sea exploration
- Find treasures hidden in the sea depths
- Album mode to check the collectibles already found
- Flower growing mode
- Varied game locations
- New trick system
- New mini games including sea racing, hit the jellyfish and deep diving

Source: The Publisher Website.

113284.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 10 No 2 - Summer 2046)
113284.description:
User Summary

"The Long Hot Summer Continues"

In this issue: Opening Fire, The World Out There, NOVA Works, 10 O'clock News, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, Nuts & Bolts, Special Feature: Cybernetic Viruses, Duelslang, 2046 Vehicle Guide Update, The Showroom, Quotes, Cube Logs, & Closing Fire.

113285.name: Princess on Ice
113285.description:
Princess on Ice sees you jump, spin and pirouette your way to fame as you follow the fortunes of Kelly, Gabrielle, Alyssa and Madison - four young ice dancers.

Plucked from obscurity by a mysterious dance trainer our heroines are trained and in turn audition for the Princess on Ice Tournament, the most prestigious ice dancing event of the year. Follow the girls through their journey as they dance their way through the world’s premier ice skating stadiums perfecting all the moves and striving to impress the judges. Do our four dancers have what it takes to be crowned ‘Princess on Ice’?

The game play is based around rhythm and action using the stylus to follow dance prompts on the lower screen. Tap circles before the time runs out to skate, follow arrows as quickly as you can to spin, touch matching shapes as they meet to jump and tap shapes before they disappear to step. Your skater will react on the upper screen to how well you are doing in the game. Drop too far down the ‘heat’ meter and
she will stumble losing valuable points with the judges.

In addition to all the ice dancing fun you can totally customise your character with fashionable accessories, clothing and headwear. There are hundreds of different combinations across the four characters giving a unique look for each. As you progress through the game you will also be rewarded with a whole host of un-lockable extras including new levels, accessories, special moves and storylines adding yet more life and fun into the game.

Features

- 4 unique characters to play each with their own storyline and skating skills
- 10 different Ice Stadiums to unlock and dance in
- Customise your characters with clothes and accessories
- Unlock new levels, special moves and storylines
- Share clothes and accessories with friends using the DS wireless connection
- 2 player wireless gaming action

Source: The Publisher Website.

113286.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 10 No 3 - Fall 2046)
113286.description:
User Summary

"THE GREAT AMERICAN SHORT STORY"

In this issue: Opening Fire, Nuts & Bolts, The Showroom, 10 O'clock News, Quotes, & Closing Fire.

113287.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 10 No 4 - Winter 2046)
113287.description:
User Summary

"THE GREAT AMERICAN BLURB"

In this issue: Opening Fire, Nuts & Bolts, The Showroom, 10 O'clock News, Quotes, & Closing Fire.

113288.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 11 No 1 - Spring 2047)
113288.description:
User Summary

Our (drum roll please) 41st Issue!!

In this issue: Opening Fire, The Soapbox, Quotes, Cube Logs, The 2047 NOVA Club Championships, The Showroom, & Closing Fire.

113289.description:
In the Old West, the wily snake oil salesman had a special talent, getting the most skeptical customers to buy the most dubious products. Now it's your turn! Invent your own zany two-word products – Rumor Mirror! Burp Balloon! – and sell them to all types of wacky customers. If the round's customer buys your product, you win!

To set up Snake Oil, each player takes six purple word cards. The customer for the round draws a customer card and announces it. Inventors quickly combine two purple word cards from their hand to form a crazy new product to sell to that customer. When ready, each inventor quickly pitches his or her product directly to the customer. The customer can end any pitch that goes longer than thirty seconds. The customer decides which product to buy and gives the inventor of that product the round's customer card as the prize. Inventors discard all used word cards and take two new word cards each. The player to the left of the customer becomes the next round's customer. Play repeats until each player has been the customer once.

Whoever collects the most customer cards wins.
113289.name: Snake Oil

113290.name: Dork Decade
113290.description:
From the back of the book
Ten years ago, a comic strip called Dork Tower made a quiet start in a magazine called Shadis. Soon moving to other venues, comic books, and web sites, Dork Tower became one of the longest-running, most critically-acclaimed and (most importantly) geekiest gaming comic strips out there. Dork Decade collects every comic strip from Shadis and Dragon magazines of the strip's first decade, chronologically and in color for the first time, along with notes, sketches and much more. Give in to the Dork side! HUZZAH!

113292.name: Pondus Pub
113292.description:
Pondus Pub is a quiz game set in the Pondus universe by cartoon drawer Frode Øverli. Each player takes turns in throwing a die and answer questions to be awarded with cheese pops, beer or red wine. These assets are needed to hit on the girls in the pub. Once you have gathered at least five of these assets (by answering questions correctly), you can try to hit on a girl. Each girl has different needs, so you might fail, and need to collect more alcohol and snacks. If you are caught by the bartender, you are sent out of the pub to go around the block and get some fresh air!

--

Fra esken: "Glem Robbie Fowler, Steven Gerrard og el Niño Torres! Hat-trick kan nå scores på en pub nær deg, nærmere bestemt Pondus Pub. Og vi snakker ikke om fotball, det er nemlig Jokkes bedrifter utenfor oldboysligaen som danner bakteppe for spillet. Holder du hodet kaldt, flaksen varm og hjernen koblet til ryggmargen, kan du bli med helt til siste runde. Spille skal svare på spørsmål i kategoriene: Fleip eller fakta, Hvorfor vet jeg dette? Rubb og rake."

113293.description:
Article 27: The United Nations Security Council Game gets its title from – yes, you guessed it – Article 27 of the United Nations Charter, which includes these two provisions:

1. Each member of the Security Council shall have one vote.
2. Decisions of the Security Council on procedural matters shall be made by an affirmative vote of nine members.

In this negotiation game, each player represents one member of the UN Security Council and will both present and be presented with different proposals.

In each round, one player acts as the UN Secretary General, presents a proposal to the Council and presides over a negotiation period that lasts no more than five minutes. The proposal will affect five issues – military, currency, etc. – in various ways, and each player has a secret document for the round that tells him how a change in each issue will affect him. All players openly negotiate on what they need in terms of points and bribes in order to vote for that proposal.

After at most five minutes, the Secretary General closes negotiations by banging his wooden gavel, then players vote yes or no on the proposal. Any "no" vote kills the proposal, as in the United Nation's actual Security Council – but vetoing a proposal costs a player points, so he might prefer to look for deals that will enable him to say "yes". The Secretary General scores a bonus when his proposal succeeds, so he and others who will benefit might be willing to negotiate to make the proposal sweet for all.

After each player has served as Secretary General once (twice in a three-player game), each player scores based on bribe money on hand, points scored from proposal cards, and how well the player fulfilled the secret agenda card he received at the start of the game.
113293.name: Article 27: The UN Security Council Game

132128.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Doomed

boardgamecompilation.157820: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box

113294.description:
Escape: The Curse of the Temple is a cooperative game in which players must escape (yes...) from a temple (yes...) which is cursed (yes...) before the temple collapses and kills one or more explorers, thereby causing everyone to lose.

The initial game board consists of a row of three square tiles, each showing a combination of two symbols, say, two green adventurers or one green adventurer and one blue key in one corner of the tile. All of the explorers start in the center tile – the safe room – and each player starts with a hand of five dice. Each die has five symbols:


A cursed mask – this die is set aside when rolled.
A golden mask – each such symbol counteracts two cursed masks, either your own or those of another explorer in the same room.
A red torch or blue key – these are used to enter rooms, access treasure, or activate gems.
A green adventurer, which appears twice on the die – you need these to move from room to room, and to activate some gems.


Escape is played in real-time, with all players rolling dice and taking actions simultaneously. You must roll the right symbols to enter a room, and if you're at an open doorway, you can roll to reveal the next tile in the stack and add it to that doorway. Some rooms contain combinations of red and blue symbols, and if you (possibly working with other players in the same room) roll enough red or blue symbols, you "discover" magic gems, moving them from a separate gem depot onto that tile.

The real-time aspect is enforced by a soundtrack to be played during the game. At certain points, a countdown starts, and if players aren't back in the safe room when time is up, they lose one of their dice.

Once the exit tile is revealed, players can attempt to escape the temple by moving to that tile, then rolling a number of blue dice equal to the magic gems that haven't been removed from the gem depot. Thus, the more gems you find, the easier it is to escape the temple. When a player escapes, he gives one die to a player of his choice. If all players escape before the third countdown, everyone wins; if not, everyone loses, no matter how many players did escape.

Escape: The Curse of the Temple includes two expansion modules that can be used individually or together. With the "Treasures" module, some rooms contain treasure, and when you reveal such a room, you place a face-down treasure chest on the tile. Roll the symbols on that chest tile, and you claim the treasure for use later: a key lets you teleport anywhere, a path lets you connect two rooms that otherwise have no door between them, and a medic kit heals all players instantly (putting black dice back into play). With the "Curses" module, some tiles "curse" players by forcing them to place one hand on their head, keep mute during play, or otherwise do what you wouldn't want to do while escaping a temple!
113294.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple

113295.name: Affenzirkus
113295.description:
Affenzirkus is a dexterity card game for children.
The game contais 49 cards with animals.
All the cards are placed face down on the tabel. By turns, players draw cards. Thank, depending on the animal drawn, players have to do dexterity tasks. For example if you draw a penguin, you have to place the card on your feet and walk 5 steps without dropping the card.
If you succede, you get the card.
The first player to have 5 different cards is the winner.

113298.name: Toni Tausendfüssler
113298.description:
objective: be the first to put on Toni's shoes
- moving/acting by turn -
each player places his meeples at one side of Toni's coloured segments
each player gets 13 shoes
roll the coloured die - step to the next coloured segment an put a wooden shoe on
continue - if the segment you stepped on is already equipped - bad luck
if the die shows white - free choice
winner is who puts on Toni's last shoe
variant: the one who puts on Toni's very last shoe (out of general supply) wins

113299.name: Ran Sat1 Fussball Quiz Super Q
113299.description:
Objective: be the first to pass the finish line finding correct answers to question cards
- moving by turn -
each player rools with 2 dice
die 1 selects question card (difficulty level)
die 2 shows no of spaces to move if successful
special areas allow to move faster (yellow, red and penalty cards)
answering questions for other players or combined activities are possible
remark:
'Ran Sat1' - this title was used for several games (Schmidt, Klee..) which can create some confusion

113300.name: Path of the Storm
113300.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone wants to know what’s going on with the Rifts movie. Well, this book presents an insight and behind the scenes info on that front by Kevin Siembieda, plus an entire screenplay written on speculation by Matthew Clements as well as game stats and artwork for major characters in the script. Kevin was so impressed with the writer’s screenplay that he had Matthew make changes and improvements and sent the second draft to Jerry Bruckheimer Films for their consideration. Meanwhile, Matthew and Kevin hit it off and the next thing he knew he became Palladium’s new staff writer.

The screenplay is a fast, fun adventure story that is sure to please Rifts fans. To make it more fun, the author has statted out the key characters in the script and gamers can use the heroes, villains and story ideas in their own campaign should they choose to do so.

This is a unique product and a fun read that should appeal to all Palladium fans. After all, it lets the reader step behind the veil and see what goes on behind the scenes.

A complete movie screenplay, with dialog.
A story that captures the feel and attitude of Rifts®.
Character stats for inclusion in your own games.
Three new demons and other villains.
Use the story and ideas in your own Rifts® campaign.
Some concept art and character illustrations.
A fun read and insight behind the scenes at Palladium.

113301.description:
In Clocks you try to make the hours count, and the clock is ticking...

Each player chooses a clock and receives a number of coins. The start player rolls a number of dice equal to the number of players plus one, then divides them into groups. All players make a simultaneous blind bid on the dice lots, with the highest bid choosing first, and so on. Each player puts the purchased die/dice on his clock in a clockwise direction, gaining money, bonus actions, or both in the process. On each turn, a player may execute one free action, in addition to buying one more action.

As soon as the value of all placed dice match the numbers on a player's clock, that player wins!
113301.name: Clocks

113303.name: Imprints
113303.description:
The Game of Photographic Memory...

Imprints is a trivia/picture identification game. Players try to earn a card from each of four categories, which is done by drawing from the deck, correctly identifying the picture on the front, then answering a trivia question related to the picture.

113304.name: Aces High
113304.description:
Aces High takes the art and science of vintage WW1 and WW2 air combat and sets it in a high intensity online multiplayer environment. Hundreds of players simultaneously battle it out against each other in massive aerial dogfights and bomber raids.

High fidelity flight simulation is the heart of Aces High but it doesn't end there. A war rages on the ground and at sea. Engage enemy armor in tank combat. Protect your fleet as a gunner or make a torpedo run in a PT boat. Lead an assault in an amphibious vehicle. With over 100 warbirds, vehicles, and boats available, you have access to a vast virtual arsenal.

Take part in special events such as historical scenarios where famous battles are recreated and reimagined or try your hand at air racing at tree top level against skilled competitors.

Source: The Developer Website.

113305.name: Fusion: Genesis
113305.description:
User Summary

Fusion: Genesis is a twin stick space shooter built into an RPG framework. You play as a space mercenary who can run missions for one of the five factions fighting for control of the galaxy. Missions range from exploration, spying, raids, or fetch quests. Persistent characters roll the plot forward, and the story changes depending on your faction.

XP gained through missions and combat gets you ship abilities, and cash allows you to upgrade to a better ship, or improve the one you have with weapons and sentient robo helper drones.

Players can open their game to others for any combination of either co-op play or PvP battles.

113306.name: Worzle
113306.description:
Worzle. The strategic word puzzle game. It’s cute and creative, fast paced and fun, and you might even learn a thing or two along the way. Two to eight players evenly distribute a total of 100 puzzle pieces. Each has a printed letter along with four wild pieces. Begin by placing a puzzle piece on the table. Start the timer. Taking turns, each player adds a piece to the puzzle. How the puzzle expands is up to you. Once every piece has been placed or time runs out, players pick up their pencils. Start the timer again and find as many words as you can. As long as the puzzle pieces are next to each other, any direction goes, however a player may not skip over a void in the puzzle to complete a word. When time runs out, using the Worzle Scoring System, the points are tallied and the player with the most wins!

Worzle is the next progression in word games. It combines the strategic component of building hidden words with the fast paced nature of finding as many as you can. It is not as simple as you might imagine. As the puzzle expands, pieces are placed in multiple directions leaving them upside down and sideways. Each player around the puzzle has a unique perspective of the game. The “building the puzzle” dynamic adds huge interest to the game.

Worzle will be packaged in a printed drawstring cotton bag complete with a timer, several custom pads and pencils all in a full color box.

113307.name: The Ancient Americas: Cities of Promise
113307.description:
From South America to Central America to North America there are remnants of large civilizations that have disappeared leaving behind only the ruins of temples, city structures and fragmented settlements. The Ancient Americas are shrouded in mystery and intrigue. The people were religious with a fashionable culture. Their cities were the central hub to life and these civilizations enjoyed much abundance and prosperity all while in the midst of conflicts that were trying to destroy them.

General Rules

This game is for 2 to 4 players ages eight to adult. Players build a 'city of promise' by building their civilization with important structures and with valuable characters that then defend the city from corruption's power.

Building Cards - Throughout the deck are Building Cards. To build structures for the 'cities of promise' and to use important historical figures within the cities, a player must try to collect specific cards and in the right amounts. Some cards cost more than others and the value of the cards vary in power. Players who gain the right building cards pay the cost of the card and a new part of the city is then added.

Game Timer - Corruption Cards play as timing cards and determine when the game ends. When the 18th Corruption Card is placed down the game ends for all players.

Each player add up their cities power points. If the total is greater than the total points of Corruption Power Points then they have WON! Yes, that's right, there can be more than one winner in this game making it more rewarding for the whole family. And if the friendly competition is that HIGH you can find out who's city had the most strength and they can be the Grand Winner!

Types of Cards

Corruption Cards - New cards are drawn at the beginning of every turn. Any time a Corruption Card is drawn it must be played during the player's turn and added to the Corruption Card area (typically the middle between all players).

Building a City - Players that purchase City Cards with the Build Cards will be able to piece the city together in any combination left to right or right to left. As players strive to get the better City Cards it may be necessary to discard unwanted or undesirable City Cards in the hopes of gaining a better one on the next draw.

Specialty Characters - Character Cards can be added to your city by purchasing them with the Build Cards and then placing them under the correct City Card they belong to. These cards also have a power point value so players can seek to add the best characters to their city to give it the best advantage.

Bonus Power Points - Saints Cards, Resources Cards, and Faith & Works Cards can be stored under Character Cards for later purchases of City Cards and Character Cards. Unused Build Cards can add additional power points at the end of the game.

113308.description:
Faggles to Faggles -- an outrageous, queered-up party game for you to enjoy with the girls. In this game of judging (hey, it's what gays do best), each card is more outrageous than the next.

Here's the deal: grab three friends or more and then draw a card with an adjective on it. The rest of the players, who hold cards with nouns on them, must play the card they think you would choose for that adjective. So, if you drew the card “racist” would you pick “the French,” “Miss Piggy” or “rainbows?”

Each card has a unique, hilarious definition that will keep you in stitches time and time again. A small investment of fifty bucks will get you hours and hours and hours and hours of entertainment. Believe us, we've played this game with dozens of people for hundreds of hours and it never gets old.
113308.name: Faggles to Faggles

113309.name: Wreck Age
113309.description:
Wreck Age is a game/world, based on the imagination of two friends and a multitude of compatriots. A world in which you are able to tell your own stories and have your own adventures.

It's a tabletop game involving miniatures that you can collect, paint, and play with, as well as a role playing game; where your imagination takes you to new lands, and on adventures. Basically, make believe and craft night for adults all rolled up into one.

A tabletop wargame is a simulation; where models are used to represent forces on a field. Our brand of tabletop game is: part wargames simulation, part strategy game, and part board game. Like chess or risk, but which allows you to "color outside the lines" a little bit.

Wreck Age play occurs on a 2'x2' board (or larger), which can either take the form of a gaming mat, or just your kitchen table. The only limit to the size, and scope of the gaming surface is your imagination.

113310.name: Necropoly
113310.description:
Necropoly (Game of the Dead) is a spin on Monopoly but the differences are a dead giveaway. Two to six players make their way around the board beginning at Death and navigating through cemeteries and pitfalls trying to build up their stash of personal burial plots and even adding tombstones and mausoleums so they can charge more for other players standing on their grave. The “Fate” and “Communal Coffin” cards are hysterical. But beware the devil in one corner; he will send you straight to the fire.
Players advance with the roll of the black dice, paying bones to the bone collector or taking in bones for fees, and the game ends when one player is the last to have bones.

A lot of cultures celebrate the dead with holidays like Halloween, Day of the Dead, and All Souls Day. This game is great for all ages and takes perhaps the scariest thing in life and makes it a fun and competitive adventure. The entire family will get into the spirit and will be laughing out loud.

113311.description:
Ethereal pirates swarm back and forth over each other's ships as the seas toss in the midnight storm. The decks of each vessel shift in and out of reality as the fighting begins. One captain and crew will emerge triumphant, and the loser will be damned to stalk the bowels of Davy Jones' locker.

Ghost Pirates is a tactical board game in which two ghost pirate Captains encounter each other on the high seas; based on old rivalries, grudges, or whatever it was that happened on Skull Island, they each turn broadside and lay-to. Each crew, following captain's orders, fights, fires cannons, and swarms their enemy's deck, attempting to force the other captain to walk the plank. Each player's turn consists of drawing a card, playing one or more cards to strengthen their ship and tactical position, moving your pirate crew, and finally, having them fight the foeman or take advantage and pillage the enemy’s ship. The goal of the game is to force your opponent’s captain to walk the plank.

Gameplay is designed to emulate tactical melee battles with a unique dice mechanic that is easy to learn and quick to play, especially for beginning gamers. It bears certain similarities to wargames like Axis and Allies, but on a much smaller, more fast-paced scale. The components are 72 cards which build the play layout and form the draw deck, 34 crew tokens, and a small handful of pirate themed six-sided dice.

Ghost Pirates was named to the 2013 GAMES 100 list, nominated for Best Family Game.
113311.name: Ghost Pirates

113312.name: Grill Party
113312.description:
It's barbecue time, so call your friends and tell them to bring the ingredients to grill!

In Grill Party, each player has a deck of twenty cards depicting the conditions for the meal – e.g., "More Steaks than Corn", "More Fish than Steaks", "No Fish", "More Wurst than anything" – and a set of wooden tokens: fish, corn, wurst and steak.

On your turn, you can exchange one token from your hand with one token on the central barbecue or in the possession of another player, then play as many cards from your hand as you can that meet the condition depicted. The first to rid himself of cards wins.

113313.name: Princess on Ice 2
113313.description:
The Diva Girls are skating back onto Nintendo DS.

Cute Kelly, sassy Madison, bookworm Alyssa and classy Gabrielle are fresh from winning the Miracle Ice Festival. Now all they have to do is deal with the fame that goes with it!

With improved 3D graphics and all-new stadiums to skate in, the girls have to step, spin and jump with style and passion if they’re going to impress the judges and win over the crowds.

Can they hold on to the coveted title of Princess on Ice?

Features

- Lush, beautiful 3D graphics – the girls have never looked so good
- Compelling story follows the next stage of the Diva Girls from Princess On Ice
- Customisable characters – change your outfits, hairstyles and equipment
- Wireless mode – compete with your friends and swap your unlocked costumes

Source: The Publisher Website.

113314.name: Spellbound (2008)
113314.description:
How good is your spelling?

Spellbound is an exciting and enjoyable game for the whole family revolving around a series of spelling based challenges. Compete in over 11 different spelling and word challenges including Spelling Bees, Odd One Out, Fifty Fifty and many more.

Advance to different levels as your spelling improves and challenge your brain in quick play mode. If that’s not enough, you can also learn words in 5 different languages!

Features

- Be challenged by over 25,000 spelling words
- 11 challenging word games
- Test your spelling in quick play mode
- Choose from 100 difficulty levels
- Learn words in 5 languages

Source: The Publisher Website.

113315.name: Subbuteo
113315.description:
The classic table football game Subbuteo scores on Nintendo DS!

Italian game developer ARTEMATICA has faithfully recreated the original tabletop football game on the Nintendo handheld, making full use of the Dual Screen functionality. Gamers interact with the game using the stylus on the lower screen to set the player position, defend, attack, pass and shoot, with full control over ball.

Using the finger-flick icon on the screen, the player can choose the angle and power of the kick just like the real thing. The upper screen gives real time feedback on all the match action with fouls, goals and even those all-important aerobatic shots.

Fully customisable Tournaments and Traditional Leagues are available, as well as a powerful game editor, allowing gamers to create new teams and change player names and colours. A comprehensive tutorial mode provides all the information on learning the basics along with the official Subbuteo rules.

Taking the game beyond the single player mode, Subbuteo players can challenge other players in a multiplayer game using the Nintendo Wi-Fi connection.

Features

- Play in fully customisable tournaments and traditional leagues.
- Play on the DS using the official Subbuteo rules.
- Tutorial Mode to learn all the basics of Subbuteo football
- The entire soccer game will be shown on the upper Nintendo Screen.
- Faithfully recreated from the original Subbuteo table game but with a more colourful, cartoon style
- A powerful editor allows the player to create new teams, change player names and strip colours providing a totally individual team selection

Source: The Publisher Website.

113316.name: The Professor's Brain Trainer: Logic
113316.description:
Give your brain a workout with the help of The Professor, using the dual screens to answer a series of puzzles and challenges.

Developed in collaboration with Dr. Makato Shichida, professor at the University of Newport, The Professor’s Brain Trainer: Logic allows you to test your logic, mathematical ability and concentration within a series of fun interactive games.

Who says learning isn’t fun!

Features

-Test your logic, mathematical ability and concentration
-A fun game that boosts your brain power
-Dr Makato’s input makes the games educational and highly addictive
-5 levels to complete

Source: The Publisher Website.

113317.name: Brain Boost: Beta Wave
113317.description:
Give your brain a workout with the help of The Professor, using the dual screens to answer a series of puzzles and challenges.

Developed in collaboration with Dr. Makato Shichida, professor at the University of Newport, The Professor’s Brain Trainer: Memory allows you to test your memory, visual association and concentration within a series of fun interactive games.

Who says learning isn’t fun!

Features

-Test your memory, visual association and concentration
-A fun game that boosts your brain power
-Dr Makato’s input makes the game educational and highly addictive
-5 challenging levels to complete

Source: The Publisher Website.

113318.name: Cooking Mama 4: Kitchen Magic
113318.description:
Cooking Mama 4 is here and Mama and Ichigo are cooking up a storm on the Nintendo 3DS™

Food is literally flying out of the kitchen as Mama makes her first appearance in 3D!

Make the most of the motion control functionality to cook with Mama in a brand new way on the Nintendo 3DS™.

Cooking Mama4 uses the 3D function for the console appropriately, providing a 3D visual reward when players successfully complete a culinary task.

Features

- Cooking with Mama - Master over 100 new recipes under Mama’s watchful eye
- Cooking with Friends - Prepare and present dishes for all your in-game friends
- New Dishes - Combine 2 exciting dishes to discover a brand new recipe
- Challenge Mode - Using the Nintendo 3DS wireless function, up to 4 players can play simultaneously, competing for high scores
- Helping Mama - Play as Ichigo and go shopping for ingredients for Mama
- Your Album - Take photos with your Nintendo 3DS camera and

Source: The Publisher Website.

113319.name: Picture Perfect Hair Salon
113319.description:
Create your new look with Hair Salon!

Hair Salon is exclusive to the Nintendo DSi. It is the perfect game for girls of all ages who are interested in the world of hair and makeup. It gives girls the opportunity to experiment with different styles – you can even use the DSi camera function to take photos of you and your friends to create brand new looks! You can also become the character in game to be styled!

Become the ultimate hair stylist and make-up artist by running your very own salon. You’ll need to master the art of hair-styling, make-up...and above all, keeping your customers happy!

Features

• Save up to 4 creations to send to your friends.
• Rise up the ranks to become the ultimate hair stylist!
• Swap images and creations wirelessly with other Hair Salon players
- see if that new haircut would really suit you!
• Perfect your hair and make-up techniques with over 15,000
combinations to use!
• The 1st DSi game to use Automatic Face Recognition –
position your face correctly and the game will automatically take
your picture.
• Learn how to cut, colour and style hair whilst perfecting your
make up style and technique.
• Keep your customers happy and earn money to go towards the
upkeep of your Salon.
• Participate in contests to win awards and increase your ranking
within the salon world.

Source: The Publisher Website.

113320.name: Greg Hastings Paintball 2
113320.description:
Authentic Paintball Action From the #1 Name in the Sport

Paintball gaming doesn’t get more realistic than this.

Create an unstoppable team of real players, load up on revolutionary new gear and guns, and brave the unpredictable elements in 62 massive fields based on real locations around the world.

This is true paintball combat... intensified.

Features

- All-New Locations: Explore a variety of terrain in 62 exciting paintball locations, inspired by some of the best paintball fields in the world!
- More Multiplayer: Challenge friends in 7 multiplayer game types with up to 20 players
- Wii Wi-Fi Connect matchmaking & leaderboards
- Local 2-player splitscreen multiplayer matches. Play together against bots or go head-to-head!
- All-New Changing Conditions: Up the ante with game-altering weather settings and hazards, such as rain, fog, wind, mud, and more!
- Three New Event Branches: Players choose their path to glory in Tournament Speedball, Recball, and Tournament Woodsball, competing in 40 diverse events.
- All-New Gear: Equip your team with a wide selection of markers, goggles, uniforms, and accessories, as well as the latest special weapons such as pump guns, pistols, paint grenades, and paint rocket launchers to take out paintball TANKS!
- Challenge Yourself in Seven Game Modes: Elimination, Capture the Flag, Single Flag, Point Capture, Assault, Sniper, and Recon.
- Command Your Team: Manage a team of up to 10 paintballers by trading players, issuing field commands, and improving skills to increase your odds for victory.
- All-New Trading Card System: Check out your teammates’ trading cards as they win games, increase skills, and buy gear. Featuring hundreds of real-life professional and amateur players from dozens of international teams.
- Improved Map Editor: Create and edit your own fields to play online!
- Show Me the Money: Win tournaments to earn cash for new gear, players, and skill upgrades!
- Wii Controller Support: Supports Wii Remote & Nunchuk, Wii Zapper, Classic Controller, Classic Controller Pro, and GameCube Controller.

Source: The Publisher Website.

113321.name: Jillian Michaels Fitness Ultimatum 2010
113321.description:
Building on the success of her first videogame, star fitness trainer Jillian Michaels returns to Wii with a new and improved fast-paced, high-intensity workout!

Set on a rugged, Pacific jungle island, players will enter a Hell Week-style boot camp filled with many new features and workout modes for 2010, including more accurate motion tracking and a calendar system enabling the user to program routines on a period of up to 6 months.

Finally, you’ll never train alone with direct feedback and motivation from Jillian for greater results!

Features

- NEW! One-on-one training with Jillian’s 3D avatar will be there through every practice sessions
- NEW! “Resolutions” Mode features a customizable training calendar that allows users to plan their routines for up to six months
- NEW! High-intensity workouts for maximum results featuring superset routines!
- 18 Core Exercises including Cardio and Strength Building Exercises
- Cardio Training
- Strength Training
- Most exercises enhanced for Balance Board.
- NEW! Work out in exotic locations: from rugged beaches to deep jungle to tropical vistas. More accurate motion tracking for more precise exercise movements.
- Multiple difficulty levels always maintain the challenge!
- Video and audio from Jillian Michaels, including training and diet tips.
- Spanish language support

Source: The Publisher Website.

113323.name: Royal Purple the Game of Kings
113323.description:
The unusual features of this game are the moves of the Prince and his acquisition of the territory upon which he sets foot. A Prince moves up or down on a dice throw of 1 or 4. Moves right or left on a throw of 2 or 5, and diagonally on a throw of 3 or 6. A player places a Dominion Marker on all squares stopped on by his Prince, and no other player may trespass on that territory when so marked. This limits the squares a Prince may move to making and unusual situation, and calling for increasing skill as the game progresses.

The person starting is determined by high roll. Turn moves to the left. Each player starts from his Corner Castle and is given a Prince, 30 Dominion Markers, and a die. Each player in turn rolls and places a Dominion Marker where the Prince lands. The first objective is to move to and place Dominion Markers on five Noble Squares (indicated by a purple board square with a white center). Then with the support of these five Nobles the Prince moves toward the Throne Space at the other side of the board. The first Prince to enter a Throne Space earns the right to wear the Royal Purple (wins).

The game plays like a cross between popular games of the day Chess and Halma with a roll and move mechanic added. A number of "Go To" squares on the board jumping players ahead to another square are an added twist.

113324.description:
Dungeon Delver is a single player, print and play card and dice game for kids. The goal of the game is to make it through the entire dungeon deck, battling monsters and surviving any traps you may encounter. There are many dangers, but don’t lose heart, because there are also useful treasures to be found along the way as well. You play as one of six heroes, each with unique abilities and each with high hopes that they will be the adventurer to complete the quest.
The rules and 54 Dungeon Delver cards can be downloaded for free. Print the cards, cut them out, grab six "hit counters" (pennies, wooden cubes, etc.) and a set of rpg dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12 and d20) to start playing.
113324.name: Dungeon Delver

113325.name: Hidden Shrine of Tamoachan
113325.description:
(From back cover)
Escape Ancient Perils

Lost in a dense jungle, pursued by hostile natives, a group of embattled adventurers searches for a place to make a stand. Instead, the group stumbles on the ruins of a long-lost civilizaion fraught with deadly traps, sinister puzzles and bizarre monsters. If the heroes want to survive, they must escape the dungeon without succumbing to the deadly poisonous gas or one of a hundred spells.

Hidden Shrine of Tamoachan is a Dungeons & Dragons Roleplaying Game adventure designed as a homage to the classic 1980 adventure. It includes a full-color poster map and features over fifty rooms filled with items, monsters and traps adapted from the original adventure.

113326.name: After Pearl
113326.description:
User Summary

A strategic simulation of the War in the Pacific (1941-1945), this game bears little resemblance to history. Reminiscent of Avalon Hill's boardgame VICTORY IN THE PACIFIC, it was quick and fun to play. Game play mandated the use of battleships as the arm of decision; carriers were useful, but the battlewagons were what decided the outcome of the war.

113327.name: Operation Matador
113327.description:
The Sortie of the Prince of Wales and Repulse December 1941

Operation Matador is a historical simulation game recreating the Allied attempt to intercept the Japanese transports heading for the Malay peninsula during the opening hours of the Pacific half of the Second World War.

This game as two components a strategic move using a map of the pacific covering the Gulf of Siam and South China Sea, specifically covering Indochina with city of Saigon and Malaya with the city of Singapore. The ship to ship combats are conducted on a small hex map.

Victory points are assigned for the number of destroyed enemy air units, submarines, transports destroyers units destroyed. In addition points are allocated for shore bombardment and any damage to enemy carrier or battlecruisers. If the Repulse or Prince of Wales are able to leave the south or south west map edge.

113328.name: You're the Banker
113328.description: You're the Banker is an educational game, designed to be played by large groups of students (up to 30 in 5 groups of 6). The game aims to teach the purpose and practices of the Federal Reserve Bank, by having teams of players run banks. Many of the consequences in the game are automated, but the teacher/moderator of the game is required to decide whether loans are sufficiently sound to accept as collateral for borrowing from the Federal Reserve.

113330.name: SSX

videogamehonor.31923: 2011 Game Critics Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee

113330.description:
From the Alps to the Andes, the Himalayas to the Rockies, ride some of the most iconic mountains in the world. Developed using real-world NASA topographical data and SSX’s own proprietary Mountain Man tool, every region delivers an exaggerated gameplay experience that is true to the rich history of the franchise.

SSX goes way beyond your typical racing experience! With wide-open terrain, multiple elevations and starting points, and no invisible walls, it’s up to your skills and imagination to discover the fastest line down the mountain.

Defy the laws of gravity by pulling off tricks that would make even the world’s greatest snowboarders cringe. Never mind a 1260° Double McTwist—in SSX, you’re still a beginner if you still have both feet strapped to the board while spinning 200 feet in the air.

Escape avalanches, rock slides, freezing cold temperatures, and more as you take Mother Nature head-on in hope of surviving some of the most treacherous descents on earth.
Explore every drop in the massive world of SSX. Set your fastest time on Race Drops, post your highest score in Trick Drops, and descend as far down the mountain as you can in Survival Drops. Instead of a traditional leaderboard showing friends’ times to beat, ghosts of your friends’ runs are visible in your world showing you exactly how they performed. Challenge your friends’ ghosts or let your ghost chalk up wins and losses as you dominate your way to the top of your Friend Leaderboards.
Constant global competition at every drop point in the SSX universe. Compete in live events against real people in real-time on every drop in the game. An event can last for a single run, hours, or even days and can support up to 100,000 participants, with your friends and closest competitors phasing in and out of your immediate surroundings at all times. Post a time and move up or down the leaderboard even if you quit out and turn off your console.
Inspired by the incredible Autolog engine that powered NFSHP, RiderNet will guide you through the incredible world of SSX by allowing you to ‘like’ your favourite drops, recommending new drops and friends, guiding you to where your friends are, or drops that their ghosts are dominating, and directing you to the biggest and best Global Events for your level.
Favorite characters including Elise, Kaori, Mac—as selected by the fans—make their return to join some new faces.
A revolutionary physics engine pushes the boundaries and defies the laws of reality, allowing you to ride and trick off anything, unrestricted by invisible walls and barriers.

Source: The Game Website.

113331.name: Joust: Heroes of the Lists
113331.description:
From the TwoHourWargames site

The crowd packed the stands, all dressed in their finest clothes, a riot of color, pennants and banners flapped in the breeze, there was a clarion call of trumpets, and the crowd fell to a hush. In twos, the Knights paraded into the Lists, horses draped in color tossed their heads and stamped their hooves to the jangle of golden spurs. The sun shone in splendor on shield and harness. Passing the Berfrois the ladies and damsels threw favors of scarves and sleeves to their favorite Knights. The presiding prince proclaimed the rules, and the heralds announced their champions.

Joust-Heroes of the Lists allows players to re-create the combat between Knights during Tournaments. Each player builds his Knight using a variety of Attributes. The goal is simple, defeat your opponents in one on one combat and gain fame, glory and yes, wealth, as you fight your way to the top, the International Tournament Circuit where all Knights are champions.

Joust can be played solo against non-player opponents or head to head against your friends. In fact, you can even play on the same side, making Joust the prefect game to teach your friends and family.

Not the traditional wargame, Joust can be played in as little as twenty minutes and is perfect for campaign games as your Knight gets better with each win.

Joust includes the Jousting Field and six colorful Knight cut-out counters.

http://www.twohourwargames.com/joheofli.html

This game is available as a PDF download and/or Print and Mail from the publisher.

113332.description:
In Bookmaker, players bet on horses in a series of races. They're not concerned about which horse wins, however, so much as making as much money as possible from the bets they place based on which race cards they hold in hand.

Each turn is divided into two phases: the bidding and the race. During each race two players will be the bookmakers, the ones who set the odds on the four horses. At the start of the race, four race cards from the deck of 80 cards are turned face-up, while each player (including each bookmaker) is dealt four race cards face down. Players look at these cards to determine which cards are out of play – that is, which horses are less likely to move during the race. The bookmakers secretly exchange two cards each to give them extra information.

Then the bookmakers individually set odds on the four horses (1:1, 1:2, and so on, with the total of the second numbers adding to at least ten). They reveal these odds to the other players, who must then place at least one bet with one bookmaker. They can place more bets if desired, even with both bookmakers. Each bookmaker records the amount bet and the odds for that horse, and he can then lower the odds on that horse if desired (but if the total of the odds would drop below ten, he must raise the payoff on another horse. Players continue placing bets as long as they want.

Once all bets are finished, players remove all cards from play, then reveal cards from the top of the deck one-by-one, moving the appropriately colored horse forward one space for each card revealed. Whichever horse reaches the #10 spot on the track first wins. All players who bet on this horse are paid off in the appropriate amount from the bookmakers. During the race, the betters can ask for credit from the bank to spend and win more money – but of course in the end, they will be forced to pay the money back to the bank with interest!

After an agreed upon number of races, with each player being bookmaker the same number of times, whoever has the most money wins!

Variant rules in Bookmaker add wild race cards that move the horse which moved on the previous turn, a bet on which horse is the nag, and a harness option in which horses can break from the track and be disqualified.
113332.name: Bookmaker

113334.name: In the Emperor's Name
113334.description:
This fan made miniatures game uses the setting of Warhammer 40,000 but the game represents fights between squads with a leader and a handful of troops, each controlled individually. The statistics of each character are Grit, Fighting Value, Shooting Value, and Speed. Several scenarios are given or players can make their own. There is also a campaign system for linking battles.

The game turn is split into three phases- movement, shooting, and melee. The players alternate turns activating all of their figures in each phase.

113335.description:
Objective:
be the first to let all of your 4 flowers (=cards) reflourish
- moving by turn -
all of the flowers fell asleep
each child tries to visit one of the elves
if this elf is matching with one of the 4 flower cards the kid started with, the card is going to be flipped (reflourish)
113335.name: Elfenkinder

113336.name: Sundown: A Call of Cthulhu Adventure of the Old West
113336.description:
From the Front Cover:

It's easy to feel alone as the shadows gather and the pale moon rises over the High Plains. The Apache say that on nights like this, the cold wind from the prairie has a mind of its own - a malignant chill, born of the darkness, which eats at your warmth, and steals all compassion.

It was a night like that when Barton Duvall rode into Tombstone. A night like that when they found what was left of little Alina Hundle - the few sad remains, barely recognizable, that Barton had left for her family to bury. And, it was a night like that when you realised that justice was more than a word bandied around by fearful shopkeepers - it was a necessity.

The year is 1880, and the posse is forming.

Sundown is a short Call of Cthulhu adventure set in the Old West and intended to be run in a single night of play, or in a three-hour convention round and was written to celebrate the 30th anniversary of Call of Cthulhu. 8 Pre-generated characters are provided.

113337.description:
In the year 1939, the world was on the brink of the largest global conflict in history. War was inevitable. But how that war was to be fought had not yet been decided. Now you can take control of your military and industrial might, and truly determine the fate of the world from the very beginning of World War II!

Global War 1939 is a variant of Axis & Allies Global 1940 (Europe 1940 and Pacific 1940 combined), but it uses it's own map that has been completely redesigned showing the world in 1939. While the basic rules are the same, nearly every facet of the game now has added depth making it entirely unique including:

- A D12 combat system
- All new playable powers Canada, UK Far East Command, Communist China, Poland, Dutch, Romania, Finland, Hungary, Bulgaria, Vichy France, and Thailand.
- Country specific combat values
- New unit types
- New political rules
- New technology system and national objectives
- Optional air combat rules

Global War 1939 recreates World War II in it's entirety. The game board is a map of the world divided into controllable areas that have unique values. Players are divided between Axis and Allied powers to fight for global supremacy using a variety of combat units familiar to Axis & Allies players. Victory goes to the player/players that take control of a number of enemy Victory Cities.
113337.name: Global War 1939

113338.name: Air Show: Circus of the Skies
113338.description:
Every summer, crowds gather in the New Mexico desert for a show like no other. Daring pilots compete in exhibitions of aerobatic skill and bravery. Dogfights, air races, and bombing runs are guaranteed to test the mettle of even the most seasoned veteran. Have you got what it takes?

Air Show is a game and a game system. Take the controls of a stunt plane and put your piloting to the test in a variety of aerial events. Manage your altitude and airspeed, perform cool stunts to turn the tables on your opponents, think fast, shoot straight, fly true, and maybe you'll take home the trophy this year.

This game uses a simultaneous action selection mechanic to program a flight plan three maneuvers in advance. Players have thirty seconds to "lock in" their maneuvers and stake out a position in turn order. When everyone is ready, maneuvers execute in turn order. Planes may dive or climb, turn right or left, accelerate or brake, or perform a stunt at the expense of altitude or airspeed. The goal differs with each event, but strategies emerge from anticipating what other players are doing and planning around that. Unlike other games of this type, such as RoboRally or Wings of War, there are no cards to play. All maneuvers are available to all players at all times, to the limits of what their current altitude and airspeed allow.

113339.name: RTX Red Rock
113339.description:
Back of box

2103 A.D. Mars needs you. You're Wheeler- a bio mechanically enhanced soldier trained to wage a one man war. Your equipment: an arsenal built into your steel arm, an electronic eye, and a robotic sidekick named IRIS. And you're going to need them.
